en: So it's just like from the Hollywood movies  where during the heist,  the observation camera is fed with prerecorded video.
zh: 正如好莱坞电影 中的抢劫片段， 观察摄像头被连上了事先录制好的视频。

en: That's cool, huh?
zh: 很酷，不是么？

en: The idea here is obviously  not only to fool the operators in the control room.
zh: 它的打算显然 不仅是要愚弄控制室中的操作员。

en: The idea  is to circumvent a digital safety system.
zh: 它的打算 是要绕过数字安全系统。

en: So for example, in a power plant,  when your big steam turbine gets too over speed,  you must open relief valves within a millisecond.
zh: 例如，在发电厂， 当巨大的蒸汽轮机转速过快时， 必须在一毫秒内打开安全阀。

en: Obviously, this cannot be done by a human operator.
zh: 显然，人类操作员不可能做到。

en: So this is where we need digital safety systems.
zh: 因此，在这儿就需要数字安全系统。

en: Your plant can blow up.
zh: 电厂会爆炸。

en: And neither your operators nor your safety system will notice it.
zh: 操作员和安全系统都不会注意到。

en: But it gets worse.
zh: 但还会更糟。

en: And this is very important, what I'm going to say.
zh: 我将要说到的，非常重要。

en: It doesn't have anything to do, in specifics,  with centrifuges,  with uranium enrichment.
zh: 它不需要对离心机， 对铀浓缩做什么 具体的事情。

en: And you don't have -- as an attacker --  you don't have to deliver this payload  by a USB stick,  as we saw it in the case of Stuxnet.
zh: 作为一名攻击者，你不需要 -- 不需要用U盘把病毒 传播出去， 如我们在震网病毒这一案例中看到的那样。

en: And if you do that,  what you end up with  is a cyber weapon of mass destruction.
zh: 如果做到了这些 最终就会拥有 一个大规模杀伤性的网络武器。

en: That's the consequence  that we have to face.
zh: 这就是我们不得不 面对的后果。

en: They're in the United States and Europe and in Japan.
zh: 而是在美国、欧洲和日本。

en: So all of the green areas,  these are your target-rich environments.
zh: 所有这些绿色的区域， 这些是目标密集的区域。

en: Ralph, it's been quite widely reported  that people assume that Mossad  is the main entity behind this.
zh: 拉尔夫，广为流传 人们认为摩萨德 是幕后主使。

en: Is that your opinion?
zh: 你怎么看？

en: Ralph Langner: Okay, you really want to hear that?
zh: 拉尔夫·兰纳：好的，你真的想知道？

en: So the leading force behind that  is the cyber superpower.
zh: 其后的主导力量 是网络超级大国。

en: There is only one,  and that's the United States --  fortunately, fortunately.
zh: 只有一个， 那就是美国 -- 很幸运，很幸运。

en: I want you now to imagine  a wearable robot  that gives you superhuman abilities,  or another one that takes wheelchair users  up standing and walking again.
zh: 我想大家现在想象一下 一个可穿戴的机器人， 它能提供给你超人般的能力， 或是让轮椅使用者 再次站起来行走。

en: These are nothing else  than something that you put on in the morning,  and it will give you extra strength,  and it will further enhance your speed,  and it will help you, for instance, to manage your balance.
zh: 还没有其他任何东西 你早晨穿上后 它将为你提供额外的力量， 它将进一步提高你的速度， 它将帮你，比如，控制平衡。

en: But not only that --  it will integrate and network you  to the universe  and other devices out there.
zh: 但不仅如此 -- 它还将整合并把你与 外界连接起来， 连接到其他设备上。

en: To show you now what we are working on  by starting out talking about  the American soldier,  that on average does carry about 100 lbs. on their backs,  and they are being asked to carry more equipment.
zh: 为了向各位展示一下我们目前在进行的工作， 我们来谈谈 美国士兵， 他们能在背上背大约100磅的重量， 而且还在被要求携带更多装备。

en: Obviously, this is resulting  in some major complications --  back injuries, 30 percent of them --  chronic back injuries.
zh: 很显然，这会导致 一些并发的问题 -- 百分之三十的士兵有背部损伤 -- 慢性背部损伤。

en: So we thought we would look at this challenge  and create an exoskeleton  that would help deal with this issue.
zh: 所以我们想我们该正视这一挑战 创造一个能帮助 解决这一问题的外骨骼。

en: So this is for real.
zh: 这是真的。

en: Now let's turn our heads  towards the wheelchair users,  something that I'm particularly passionate about.
zh: 现在让我们把视线 转向轮椅使用者， 这是我个人非常热爱的部分。

en: There are 68 million people  estimated to be in wheelchairs worldwide.
zh: 世界上估计有 6千8百万轮椅使用者。

en: This is about one percent of the total population.
zh: 大约占人口总数的百分之一。

en: And that's actually a conservative estimate.
zh: 这是个保守的估计。

en: We are talking here about, oftentimes,  very young individuals with spinal cord injuries,  that in the prime of their life -- 20s, 30s, 40s --  hit a wall  and the wheelchair's the only option.
zh: 我们现在要说的是， 有脊髓损伤的非常年轻的人 在年富力强的时候 -- 20岁，30岁，40岁 -- 碰了壁 轮椅就成了唯一的选择。

en: But it is also the aging population  that is multiplying in numbers.
zh: 而且人口老龄化也 使得这一数字成倍增长。

en: And the only option, pretty much --  when it's stroke or other complications --  is the wheelchair.
zh: 而这唯一的选择，大致上 -- 当人患有中风或是其他病症时 -- 就是轮椅。

en: And that is actually for the last 500 years,  since its very successful introduction, I must say.
zh: 实际上最近500年来都是这样， 这是非常成功的介绍，我必须说。

en: Let me now introduce you to eLEGS  that is worn by Amanda Boxtel  that 19 years ago was spinal cord injured,  and as a result of that  she has not been able to walk  for 19 years until now.
zh: 现在让我向各位介绍eLEGS， 穿着者是阿曼达·波斯特， 她19年前受到了脊柱损伤， 由此导致 她19年来无法行走， 直到现在。

en: Amanda Boxtel: Thank you.
zh: 阿曼达·波斯特：谢谢。

en: EB: Amanda is wearing our eLEGS set.
zh: 艾瑟：我说了，阿曼达穿着的就是我们的eLEGS。

en: It's completely non-invasive,  sensors in the crutches  that send signals back to our onboard computer  that is sitting here at her back.
zh: 在这些支撑内完全是非侵入的 传感器， 它们发送信号至装在 她背部的机载电脑。

en: There are battery packs here as well  that power motors that are sitting at her hips,  as well as her knee joints,  that move her forward  in this kind of smooth and very natural gait.
zh: 同时还有个电池组， 为装在她臀部的电动机提供能量， 包括她膝关节处的电动机， 这让她能 以平稳自然的步伐前进。

en: In a split second,  I lost all sensation and movement  below my pelvis.
zh: 在那一瞬间， 我失去了骨盆以下的所有 感觉和活动能力。

en: He robbed  every ounce of hope  Adaptive technology  has since enabled me  to learn how to downhill ski again,  to rock climb and even handcycle.
zh: 他剥夺了 我存在的 每一丝希望。 自适应技术 曾使我能够 再次学习如何速降滑雪， 攀岩，甚至手动自行车。

en: But nothing has been invented  that enables me to walk,  until now.
zh: 但没有什么发明 能让我行走， 直到现在。

en: Thank you.
zh: 谢谢。

en: EB: As you can see,  we have the technology,  we have the platforms  to sit down and have discussions with you.
zh: 艾瑟：正如各位所看到的， 我们有了技术， 我们有了能坐下 的平台，这已经和大家讨论过了。

en: And no, this isn't Burning Man  or San Francisco.
zh: 不是的，这不是指欲火焚烧的男人 也不是指旧金山。

en: This is the world of wild bonobos  in the jungles of Congo.
zh: 这就是野生倭黑猩猩的世界 座落于刚果的丛林中。

en: Bonobos are, together with chimpanzees,  your living closest relative.
zh: 倭黑猩猩和黑猩猩是 我们大家生活里最密切相关的近亲。

en: That means we all share a common ancestor,  an evolutionary grandmother,  who lived around six million years ago.
zh: 这意味我们都享有一个共同的祖先， 一个进化了的祖母， 她生活在大约6百万年前。

en: But unfortunately,  we have made too much of an emphasis  of this aspect  in our narratives of human evolution.
zh: 但不幸的是， 我们已经过分强调 这方面 在人类进化的历史中所起的作用。

en: These guys have really worked something out,  since this leads to a highly tolerant society  where fatal violence  has not been observed yet.
zh: 这些倭黑猩猩能相安无事地生活在一起， 由此形成了一个高度包容性的社会 在这社群，致命的暴力行为 还没有被观察到。

en: They live in the depths of the Congolese jungle,  and it has been very difficult to study them.
zh: 它们生活在刚果丛林的深处， 所以对它们的研究就是非常困难。

en: The Congo is a paradox --  a land of extraordinary biodiversity and beauty,  but also the heart of darkness itself --  the scene of a violent conflict  that has raged for decades  and claimed nearly as many lives  as the First World War.
zh: 刚果是个似是而非的矛盾体-- 她是一块孕育非凡的生物多样性和美丽的土地， 但她自身也是黑暗之心-- 暴力冲突的场景 已经持续了几十年 这夺走了许多生命 就如第一次世界大战一样。

en: Bushmeat trades and forest loss  means we couldn't fill a small stadium  with all the bonobos that are left in the world --  and we're not even sure of that to be honest.
zh: 猎寻兽肉的买卖和丛林消失 意味着我们不能 给在世界上仅存的倭黑猩猩们提供一个小小的栖息地-- 实话，我们甚至都不能确定是否会有一个小的栖息地。

en: Who are these cousins?
zh: 这些近亲是些什么动物啊？

en: Now, I'm not saying this is the solution  to all of humanity's problems --  since there's more to bonobo life  than the Kama Sutra.
zh: 我现在不是说这就是解决 人类所有问题的方法-- 因为玩乐对于倭黑猩猩来说 比起欲经意味更多。

en: For us and them,  play is foundational for bonding relationships  and fostering tolerance.
zh: 对于我们人类和倭黑猩猩， 玩乐是建立亲密关系 和培养容忍性的基础。

en: It's where we learn to trust  and where we learn about the rules of the game.
zh: 它也让我们学会信任 和游戏的规则

en: Play is the glue  that binds us together.
zh: 玩乐就是粘结剂 使得我们相互联系在一起。

en: First, it's a ball game bonobo-style --  and I do not mean football.
zh: 首先，这是一个倭黑猩猩式的球类游戏-- 我不是指足球。

en: And this video is really interesting  because it shows --  this video's really interesting  because it shows the inventiveness  of bringing unusual elements into play --  such as testicles --  and also how play both requires trust  and fosters trust --  while at the same time being tremendous fun.
zh: 这个视频真的很有趣 因为它证明-- 这个视频真的很有趣 因为它证明了 把不寻常的因素带进游戏里所产生的创造性-- 例如睾丸-- 游戏如何能寻求信任 和培养信任-- 与此同时又乐趣无穷。

en: Play's a shapeshifter,  and it can take many forms,  some of which are more quiet,  imaginative, curious --  maybe where wonder is discovered anew.
zh: 玩乐是一个变形的过程， 它可以变成许多玩乐游戏， 一些游戏是较安静的， 富有想象力的，探于求索的-- 或许这玩乐的奇妙是发现新鲜事。

en: And I want you to see,  this is Fuku, a young female,  and she is quietly playing with water.
zh: 我想让大家看看， 这是福酷，一个年轻雌倭黑猩猩， 她正在悄然地玩耍水。

en: And it's that playful curiosity  that drives us to explore, drives us to interact,  and then the unexpected connections we form  are the real hotbed for creativity.
zh: 正是玩乐的新奇感 驱使我们去探索，驱使我们去互动联系。 然后我们所形成的这种意想不到的联系 是真正孕育创造力的温床。

en: So these are just small tasters  into the insights that bonobo give us  to our past and present.
zh: 因此这些仅是浅尝而已 由倭黑猩猩带给我们这种深刻的洞察力 来探索我们的过去和现在。

en: But will we make the most of our playfulness?
zh: 但我们要尽可能地嬉戏玩乐吗？

en: In times when it seems least appropriate to play,  it might be the times when it is most urgent.
zh: 好似最不适宜去玩乐的时候， 但它可能是最迫切需要玩乐的时候。

en: And so, my fellow primates,  let us embrace this gift from evolution  and play together,  as we rediscover creativity,  fellowship and wonder.
zh: 那么，我的灵长类的同胞们， 让我们拥护这天赋进化的礼物 让我们一起嬉戏玩乐， 由此我们重新发现创造力， 情同手足的关系和奇迹。

en: Thank you.
zh: 谢谢。

en: When I'm not fighting poverty, I'm fighting fires  as the assistant captain of a volunteer fire company.
zh: 在我消灭贫穷之余，我也灭火 我是志愿消防居的副指挥

en: I was the second volunteer on the scene,  so there was a pretty good chance I was going to get in.
zh: 我是第二个到现场的志愿者 很有可能可以进火场

en: When I found the captain,  he was having a very engaging conversation  with the homeowner,  who was surely having one of the worst days of her life.
zh: 当我好不容易找到总指挥 他正全神贯注地 和屋主讨论 她显然正经历人生中最糟糕的一天

en: Here it was, the middle of the night,  she was standing outside in the pouring rain,  under an umbrella, in her pajamas, barefoot,  while her house was in flames.
zh: 当时是大半夜 她站在滂沱大雨中 穿着睡衣、打赤脚、撑着伞 她的房子正在熊熊燃烧

en: The other volunteer who had arrived just before me --  let's call him Lex Luther --    got to the captain first  and was asked to go inside  and save the homeowner's dog.
zh: 另外一个比我先来一步的志愿者 就叫他Lex Luther 好了  先到了总指挥身边 他被分配到 杀进火场去拯救屋主的小狗

en: Here was some lawyer or money manager  who, for the rest of his life, gets to tell people  that he went into a burning building  to save a living creature,  just because he beat me by five seconds.
zh: 这个律师或财务经理 终身都可以告诉别人 他深入火场 救出一条活生生的小狗 就因为他比我早到五秒

en: A few weeks later,  the department received a letter from the homeowner  thanking us for the valiant effort displayed  in saving her home.
zh: 几个礼拜后 我们部门收到从屋主来的一封信 谢谢我们的拯救她家的 义勇行为

en: The act of kindness she noted above all others:  someone had even gotten her a pair of shoes.
zh: 她特别提到一件温馨的细节 甚至有人为她拿来一双鞋

en: They all matter.
zh: 它们都一样重要。

en: So as I look around this room  at people who either have achieved,  or are on their way to achieving,  remarkable levels of success,  I would offer this reminder:  don't wait.
zh: 当我环顾四周 这些成功的 或正要成功的人士 你们都有着令人激赏的成就 我想在这里提醒你们： 不要等待

en: Don't wait until you make your first million  to make a difference in somebody's life.
zh: 不要等待你赚到第一个一百万 才开始改变别人的生活

en: If you have something to give,  give it now.
zh: 如果你有什么可以给予 现在就开始付出

en: Not every day is going to offer us a chance  to save somebody's life,  but every day offers us an opportunity to affect one.
zh: 不是每一天我们都有机会 拯救他人的生命 但每一天我们都有机会影响他人的生命

en: Thank you.
zh: 谢谢各位

en: Mark Bezos: Thank you.
zh: 谢谢各位

en: This may sound strange,  but I'm a big fan of the concrete block.
zh: 听起来可能有点怪， 我是个水泥砖的狂热爱好者。

en: The first concrete blocks were manufactured in 1868  with a very simple idea:  modules made of cement of a fixed measurement  that fit together.
zh: 第一块水泥砖制造于1868年 是源于一个非常简单的想法： 把水泥制成的固定大小的块 组装到一起。

en: They enabled us to to build things that were larger than us,  buildings, bridges,  one brick at a time.
zh: 它使得我们能制造远大于自身的东西， 建筑，桥梁， 就这样一砖一瓦砌成。

en: Almost a hundred years later in 1947,  LEGO came up with this.
zh: 在大约100年后的1947年， 乐高带来了这个

en: It was called the Automatic Binding Brick.
zh: 当时被叫做自动组装积木。

en: It's estimated that over 400 billion bricks have been produced --  or 75 bricks for every person on the planet.
zh: 据估计已经制造出的乐高积木超过4千亿块 -- 或者说全球人均75块

en: LEGO has essentially taken the concrete block, the building block of the world,  and made it into the building block  of our imagination.
zh: 乐高实质上就是把水泥砖，这种真实世界中的积木， 运用到建造我们想象中的 建筑积木。

en: Like the concrete block,  the transistor allows you to build  much larger, more complex circuits, one brick at a time.
zh: 像水泥砖一样， 你可以运用它 一个晶体管一个晶体管地制造出更大的、更复杂的电路。

en: But there's a main difference:  The transistor was only for experts.
zh: 但是有一个主要的区别： 只有专家才能玩转晶体管。

en: I personally don't accept this,  that the building block of our time  is reserved for experts,  so I decided to change that.
zh: 我个人不能接受 我们这个时代的积木 只有专家才可以玩， 所以我决定改变它。

en: Let me show you how they work.
zh: 我给大家演示一下是怎么玩的。

en: And the best part about it  is they snap together with magnets.
zh: 最棒的就是 它们是用磁力吸合在一起的

en: So you can't put them the wrong way.
zh: 所以就不可能组装错

en: So all you need to do is snap a blue to a green  and very quickly you can start making larger circuits.
zh: 因此你所需要做的就是把蓝色接到绿色上 然后很快你就能开始制造更大的电路了

en: You put a blue to a green,  you can make light.
zh: 把蓝的接到绿的， 你就做了一个灯

en: I'm going to stop that.
zh: 我得收手了。

en: The idea behind littleBits  is that it's a growing library.
zh: 隐藏在littleBits之后的想法是 这是一个可成长的资料库。

en: We've been giving littleBits to kids and seeing them play with them.
zh: 我们曾经把littleBits给孩子们并看他们玩。

en: The nicest thing is how they start to understand  the electronics around them from everyday  that they don't learn at schools.
zh: 最棒的就是他们开始理解 他们日常身边的电器 这些学校里是学不到的。

en: Here you see, with felt and paper water bottles,  we have Geordie making ...
zh: 大家可以看到，用毡和纸瓶子 乔迪做出了...

en: It's a lobster made of playdough  that's afraid of the dark.
zh: 是一个橡皮泥做的龙虾 它很怕黑。

en: And we want to make this material accessible to everyone.
zh: 而且我们想使这种材料对所有人都可用。

en: So littleBits is open-source.
zh: 所以littleBits是开源的。

en: You can go on the website, download all the design files, make them yourself.
zh: 你可以到网站上，下载所有的设计文件，自己来制造。

en: So go ahead and start inventing.
zh: 不要犹豫，开始你的发明吧。

en: And my small startup  is looking to force ourselves  into the environment  by paying attention to ...
zh: 我那间小小的公司刚刚创办 正在寻求迫使我们 融入自然的方法 这要通过关注...

en: It's just a quick video  of what we do.
zh: 这段小视频 展示了我们所做的工作

en: It might take a moment to load.
zh: 加载视频需要点时间

en: We'll just -- we can just skip --  I'll just skip through the video instead ...
zh: 也许我们可以跳过-- 我会跳过视频...

en: This is not ...
zh: 这不是...

en: Oh, that's all my time?
zh: 不会吧，我的时间已经到了？

en: Okay. Thank you very much.
zh: 好吧，非常感谢

en: So a couple of years ago I started a program  to try to get the rockstar tech and design people  and work in the one environment  that represents pretty much everything they're supposed to hate;  we have them work in government.
zh: 几年前，我启动了一个 让一些厉害的搞技术和设计的人员们 在一个应该代表 他们所憎恨的一切的环境 - 政府部门 - 内工作一年的项目。

en: The program is called Code for America,  and it's a little bit like a Peace Corps for geeks.
zh: 这个项目叫做 “美国代码”， 有点像怪杰的和平队。

en: We select a few fellows every year  and we have them work with city governments.
zh: 我们每年筛选几个人， 然后让他们为政府工作。

en: Instead of sending them off into the Third World,  we send them into the wilds of City Hall.
zh: 不将他们送入第三世界， 但将他们送入市政府厅。

en: But really what they're doing is they're showing what's possible  with technology today.
zh: 但他们真正的目的是展现今天科技 可以创造的可能性。

en: Here it kind of looks like he's looking for a date,  but what he's really looking for is for someone to shovel him out when he gets snowed in,  because he knows he's not very good at fighting fires  when he's covered in four feet of snow.
zh: 这里看起来它似乎是在等它的约会， 但它真正等待的是一个可以将它被深埋在雪下的时候可以将它挖出来的人， 因为它知道当它被四英尺的雪埋入时， 它救火的能力就会下降。

en: They were there in February, and it snowed a lot in February last year.
zh: 他们在的时候正值二月，而去年二月雪下得很多很大。

en: But one fellow in particular,  a guy named Erik Michaels-Ober,  noticed something else,  and that's that citizens are shoveling out sidewalks  right in front of these things.
zh: 那个团队的其中一个人， 叫Erik Michaels-Ober， 留意到了另外一个现象： 市民们会将这些消防栓 前面的走道上的雪铲除。

en: So he did what any good developer would do,  he wrote an app.
zh: 所以他做了任何一个优秀的程序员都会做的事情， 他写了一个应用程序。

en: It's a cute little app where you can adopt a fire hydrant.
zh: 这是一个可以让你领养一个消防栓的可爱简易的程序。

en: So you agree to dig it out when it snows.
zh: 然后你同意会在下雪后将它挖出。

en: And if you don't, someone can steal it from you.
zh: 但如果你不将它挖出，其他人可以将它从你那儿偷走。

en: So it's got cute little game dynamics on it.
zh: 所以它有一些小小的娱乐性质在里面。

en: This is a modest little app.
zh: 这是一个相对来说比较小的程序，

en: But it's doing something  that no other government technology does.
zh: 但它做到了 任何其他政府科技无法做到的事情；

en: There's a guy in the I.T. department of the City of Honolulu  who saw this app and realized  that he could use it, not for snow,  but to get citizens to adopt tsunami sirens.
zh: 一个在夏威夷檀香山市的IT部门上班的人 看到了这个程序，然后意识到 它不一定要用它来铲雪， 也可以用它让市民领养海啸警报器。

en: It's very important that these tsunami sirens work,  but people steal the batteries out of them.
zh: 这些海啸警报器的功能很重要， 但往往有人会偷那里面的电池。

en: And Chicago just rolled it out  to get people to sign up to shovel sidewalks when it snows.
zh: 芝加哥才开始 用它让人们将走道上的雪铲除。

en: So we now know of nine cities  that are planning to use this.
zh: 我们现在知道还有九个城市 计划使用它。

en: If you know anything about government technology,  you know that this isn't how it normally goes.
zh: 如果你对政府的科技有些了解， 你会知道这并不是普遍的结果。

en: We had a team that worked on a project in Boston last year  that took three people about two and a half months.
zh: 去年我们在伯斯顿有一个 三个人的团队花了两个半月完成了一个项目。

en: It was a way that parents could figure out  which were the right public schools for their kids.
zh: 它可以帮助家长决定 哪一个公立学校对他们的孩子最适合。

en: We were told afterward that if that had gone through normal channels,  it would have taken at least two years  and it would have cost about two million dollars.
zh: 之后，我们被告知，如果这个项目通过正常的渠道， 它将需要至少两年的时间， 并会花费将近两百万美元左右。

en: And that's nothing.
zh: 而这只是一个小数字。

en: There is one project in the California court system right now  that so far cost taxpayers  two billion dollars,  and it doesn't work.
zh: 加利福尼亚的法院系统正有一个 至今花费了纳税人 二十亿美元的一个项目， 而它还并不能正常运作。

en: And there are projects like this  at every level of government.
zh: 而在政府的每一个阶级 都有类似的种种项目。

en: So an app that takes a couple of days to write  and then spreads virally, that's sort of a shot across the bow  to the institution of government.
zh: 所以一个只需要几天来编程， 并像病毒般散布的程序， 对政府机构来说 是一个警钟。

en: It suggests how government could work better --  not more like a private company,  as many people think it should.
zh: 它见证了政府可以变得更有效率 - 但不是更像私有公司， 像很多人觉得的那样。

en: And that means permissionless,  it means open, it means generative.
zh: 这意味着无须批准， 公开，多产。

en: But what's more important about this app  is that it represents how a new generation  is tackling the problem of government --  not as the problem of an ossified institution,  but as a problem of collective action.
zh: 但这种程序所代表的，更重要的， 是新一代的人 将政府的问题 当作团体行动的问题来寻求解决方式， 而并不是一个死板的机构。

en: And that's great news,  because, it turns out, we're very good at collective action  with digital technology.
zh: 而这是很好的信息， 因为，事实表明，我们在对于数码技术 的团体运行非常擅长。

en: Now there's a very large community of people  that are building the tools that we need  to do things together effectively.
zh: 现在已经有一个非常大的团体 在建造可以让我们做事 更加有效率的工具。

en: It's not just Code for America fellows,  there are hundreds of people all over the country  that are standing and writing civic apps  every day in their own communities.
zh: 它不仅仅是“美国代码”的员工们， 全国有几百个人 每天在自己的社区中编写程序 并将其致用在他们自己的社区。

en: They are frustrated as hell with it,  but they're not complaining about it,  they're fixing it.
zh: 虽然他们对此非常失望， 但他们并没有抱怨， 而在尝试着改善它。

en: And these folks know something  that we've lost sight of.
zh: 这些人知道一些 我们已经失去的东西，

en: And if you're one of those people,  I would ask that you reconsider,  because things are changing.
zh: 如果你是他们其中的一个， 我希望你能重新考虑下， 因为很多事情都在改变。

en: And because government  ultimately derives its power from us --  remember "We the people?" --  how we think about it  is going to effect how that change happens.
zh: 而因为政府的能量， 从最根本上 来自于我们人民， 我们如何看待它 将会影响到它的改变。

en: If you should ever have the chance  to staff your city's call center,  as our fellow Scott Silverman did as part of the program --  in fact, they all do that --  you will find that people call government  with a very wide range of issues,  including having an opossum stuck in your house.
zh: 如果你会有机会 在你的市热线中心工作， 像我们项目的同事Scott Silverman就做这个 - 事实上，他们都需要做这项服务 - 你就会发现人们为了非常不同的问题 打电话给政府咨询， 包括家中困入了一个负鼠。

en: He doesn't really come up with anything. He starts with animal control.
zh: 什么都没有。他从动物控制中心开始。

en: And finally, he says, "Look, can you just open all the doors to your house  and play music really loud  and see if the thing leaves?"
zh: 而最后，他说：“这样吧，你可以将你家的门全部打开， 然后放起很大声的音乐， 然后看看这东西会不会离开？”

en: So one day -- this is an actual report -- this came in:  "Opossum in my trashcan. Can't tell if it's dead.
zh: 有一天 - 这是一个真实的报告 - 这个信息被贴了出来： “垃圾桶里有一个负鼠。看不出来它是否死了。

en: But what happens with Citizens Connect is different.
zh: “市民联通”对这种问题有不同的处理方式。

en: But on Citizens Connect everything is public,  so everybody can see this.
zh: 但在“市民联通”上面一切都是公开的， 所以每个人都可以看见。

en: And in this case, a neighbor saw it.
zh: 这一次，一个邻居看到了。

en: Turned trashcan on its side. Walked home.
zh: 将垃圾桶放倒，走回家。

en: And I don't mean necessarily  a technological definition of platform here.
zh: 而在这里我并不是 在说平台的技术层面的定义。

en: I'm just talking about a platform for people  to help themselves and to help others.
zh: 我只是想提到一个可以让 人们互相帮助的平台。

en: And it could have connected them with government services if they'd been needed,  but a neighbor is a far better and cheaper alternative  to government services.
zh: 它可以通过政府设施服务来帮助需要的人， 但一个邻居远比政府服务 简单和见效。

en: When one neighbor helps another,  we strengthen our communities.
zh: 当一个邻居帮助另外一个的时候， 我们的社会联系也会加强。

en: We call animal control, it just costs a lot of money.
zh: 我们打电话给动物控制中心的话，只会花很多的钱。

en: Now one of the important things we need to think about government  is that it's not the same thing as politics.
zh: 一个我们需要思考的很重要的事情 便是政府并不同于政治。

en: And most people get that,  but they think that one is the input to the other.
zh: 很多人明白这点， 但他们仍然认为政治是政府的输入口。

en: Now how many times have we elected a political leader --  and sometimes we spend a lot of energy  getting a new political leader elected --  and then we sit back and we expect government  to reflect our values and meet our needs,  and then not that much changes?
zh: 至今为止，我们选了多少政治领袖 - 而有些时候我们会花大量的精力 来支持一个新的政治领袖的选举 - 然后我们期望着政府做一些 反映我们价值观和我们的需要的事情， 但最后没有多少改变发生？

en: And what's under that  is what we call bureaucracy.
zh: 下面的便是 我们所谓的官僚机构。

en: But it's that contempt  that keeps this thing that we own  and we pay for  as something that's working against us, this other thing,  and then we're disempowering ourselves.
zh: 但正是这种鄙夷 保持了这个我们拥有 并为其付钱维持的东西 一直与我们的愿望背道而驰， 而由此我们正失去我们自己的能量。

en: It's a group of concerned citizens  that have written a very detailed  325-page report  that's a response to the SEC's request for comment  on the Financial Reform Bill.
zh: 他们是一群忧心忡忡的公民 他们写了一份非常详细的， 325页的报告 来回应美国证券交易委员会SEC 对于金融改革法案的要求。

en: That's not being politically active,  that's being bureaucratically active.
zh: 这不是参与政治， 而是积极参与到官僚机构中。

en: Now for those of us who've given up on government,  it's time that we asked ourselves  about the world that we want to leave for our children.
zh: 现在，对于我们之间的已经放弃了政府的人， 是时候问我们自己 我们希望留下怎样的世界给我们的孩子。

en: The good news is that technology is making it possible  to fundamentally reframe  the function of government  in a way that can actually scale  by strengthening civil society.
zh: 好的消息是，科技正使这变得可行 在本质上重新定义 政府的功能 而通过它我们可以 来加强我们的公民社会。

en: And there's a generation out there that's grown up on the Internet,  and they know that it's not that hard  to do things together,  you just have to architect the systems the right way.
zh: 现在的一代正在网络中长大， 而他们知道 同时做一件事情并不难， 只需要将系统建构好。

en: Now the average age of our fellows is 28,  so I am, begrudgingly,  almost a generation older than most of them.
zh: 我们的工作人员的平均年龄是28岁， 所以我，很不甘的， 几乎比他们大部分老了一代。

en: This is a generation  that's grown up taking their voices pretty much for granted.
zh: 这一代 在长大中已经习惯代言他们自身。

en: They're not fighting that battle that we're all fighting  about who gets to speak;  they all get to speak.
zh: 他们不再需要经历我们那一代关于 谁可以拥有言论自由的战斗； 他们都拥有言论自由。

en: They're using their hands  to write applications that make government work better.
zh: 他们正在使用他们的双手 来编写可以让政府更好地运作的程序。

en: And those applications let us use our hands  to make our communities better.
zh: 而这些程序让我们用我们自己的双手 来完善我们的社会。

en: That could be shoveling out a hydrant, pulling a weed,  turning over a garbage can with an opossum in it.
zh: 它可以是将消防栓从雪中挖出，将杂草拔除， 或将有负鼠的垃圾桶放倒。

en: And certainly, we could have been shoveling out those fire hydrants all along,  and many people do.
zh: 当然，很多人早就开始将消防栓 从雪中挖出了。

en: But these apps are like little digital reminders  that we're not just consumers,  and we're not just consumers of government,  putting in our taxes and getting back services.
zh: 但这些程序就如同小数字闹钟，可以提醒 我们不光是作为消费者。 我们也不仅仅是政府的消费对象， 缴税而换回服务。

en: So the question I have for all of you here:  When it comes to the big, important things  that we need to do together,  all of us together,  are we just going to be a crowd of voices,  or are we also going to be  a crowd of hands?
zh: 所以在这里我留给大家一个问题： 当我们面对一些很大的，很重要的， 并需要我们齐心协力一起做 事情的时候， 我们会只是有话语权的一群人， 还是我们 也会是众手协力而成事的一群人？

en: Thank you.
zh: 谢谢。

en: Well this is a really extraordinary honor for me.
zh: 很荣幸来到这里

en: I spend most of my time  in jails, in prisons, on death row.
zh: 我大多数时候都 在管教所，在监狱里，在死囚室中

en: I spend most of my time in very low-income communities  in the projects and places where there's a great deal of hopelessness.
zh: 大部分时间我在低收入的社区里工作 在充满绝望的地区，做前途暗淡的项目

en: And being here at TED  and seeing the stimulation, hearing it,  has been very, very energizing to me.
zh: 今天来到TED 看到听到这些激动人心的演讲 给了我一针强心剂

en: And sometimes when it comes through TED,  it has meaning and power  that it doesn't have when it doesn't.
zh: 有时当事情发生在TED的讲台上 比发生在别处 更有意义，更有影响

en: And I mention that because I think identity is really important.
zh: 我提起这个是因为我觉得自我定位很重要

en: And I think what we've learned  is that, if you're a teacher your words can be meaningful,  but if you're a compassionate teacher,  they can be especially meaningful.
zh: 我们已经体会到 作为一个老师，你的话是有影响力的 如果你是个很慈善的老师 你的教导就格外意味深长

en: If you're a doctor you can do some good things,  but if you're a caring doctor you can do some other things.
zh: 作为一个医生，你能够帮助人 如果你是个体恤病人的医生，你能帮助更多

en: And I didn't learn about this actually  practicing law and doing the work that I do.
zh: 我不是从做律师 或者做其他项目学到怎样自我定位的

en: I grew up in a house  that was the traditional African-American home  that was dominated by a matriarch,  and that matriarch was my grandmother.
zh: 我的家庭 是一个传统的黑人家庭 只有一个女家长 就是我的外婆

en: She was tough, she was strong,  she was powerful.
zh: 她很坚韧， 也很强壮 威风凛凛

en: She was the end of every argument in our family.
zh: 家里有争执，她有决定权

en: She was the beginning of a lot of arguments in our family.
zh: 不过很多事儿也是她挑起来的

en: She was the daughter of people who were actually enslaved.
zh: 她的父母曾是真正的黑奴

en: When I would see her as a little boy,  she'd come up to me and she'd give me these hugs.
zh: 当我是个小男孩时 每次见到她都拥抱我

en: And she'd squeeze me so tight I could barely breathe  and then she'd let me go.
zh: 她抱得那么紧，我都透不过气来 然后她才会放开我

en: And an hour or two later, if I saw her,  she'd come over to me and she'd say, "Bryan, do you still feel me hugging you?"
zh: 一两个小时之后，当我再见她 她会过来问我：“还能感觉我的拥抱么？”

en: And if I said, "No," she'd assault me again,  and if I said, "Yes," she'd leave me alone.
zh: 如果我说“感觉不到了”，她就再度出击 直到我说“感觉得到”，她才放开我

en: My mom was the youngest of her 10 kids.
zh: 我妈妈是十个里最年轻的

en: And I remember, when I was about eight or nine years old,  waking up one morning, going into the living room,  and all of my cousins were running around.
zh: 我记得，当我八九岁时的一次 我早上醒来，跑到客厅 所有的表兄妹都在

en: And I would look at her and I'd smile,  but she was very serious.
zh: 我就看回去，对她笑笑 但我外婆是很严肃的

en: And after about 15 or 20 minutes of this,  she got up and she came across the room  and she took me by the hand  and she said, "Come on, Bryan. You and I are going to have a talk."
zh: 大概十五还是二十分钟之后 她站起来，穿过房间 牵住我的手 对我说：“过来，布莱恩，我们得谈谈。”

en: And I remember this just like it happened yesterday.
zh: 这就像是昨天才发生的一样

en: I never will forget it.
zh: 我永远忘不掉

en: She took me out back and she said, "Bryan, I'm going to tell you something,  but you don't tell anybody what I tell you."
zh: 她把我带到一边说：“我想和你说些事， 你不许和任何人说。”

en: She said, "Now you make sure you don't do that." I said, "Sure."
zh: 她说：“保证绝不说出去。”我回答：“保证。”

en: Then she sat me down and she looked at me  and she said, "I want you to know  I've been watching you."
zh: 然后我们坐下，她看着我 说：“我想让你知道 我观察你一段时间了。”

en: And she said, "I think you're special."
zh: 接着她说：“你是个特别的孩子。”

en: She said, "I think you can do anything you want to do."
zh: 她说：“我确信你是无所不能的。”

en: She said, "The first thing I want you to promise me  is that you'll always love your mom."
zh: 她说：“第一，我想让你保证 你会永远爱你的妈妈。”

en: Well I adored my mom, so I said, "Yes, Mama. I'll do that."
zh: 我很爱我妈妈，我说：“好，姥姥，我会。”

en: Then she said, "The second thing I want you to promise me  is that you'll always do the right thing  even when the right thing is the hard thing."
zh: 接着她说：“第二件事，是你要答应我 你会永远走正路 即使走正路是很难的选择。”

en: And I thought about it and I said, "Yes, Mama. I'll do that."
zh: 我想了想回答：“好的姥姥，我会的。”

en: Then finally she said, "The third thing I want you to promise me  is that you'll never drink alcohol."
zh: 最后她说：“第三件事，我要你保证 你永不喝酒。”

en: Well I was nine years old, so I said, "Yes, Mama. I'll do that."
zh: 我才九岁，我答应：“好，姥姥，我保证。”

en: When I was about 14 or 15,  one day my brother came home and he had this six-pack of beer --  I don't know where he got it --  and he grabbed me and my sister and we went out in the woods.
zh: 当我十四五岁时 一天我哥哥带回到家半打啤酒—— 我都不知道他怎么弄到的—— 他带上我和我妹妹，跑到树林里

en: And we were kind of just out there doing the stuff we crazily did.
zh: 一通疯玩疯跑

en: And he had a sip of this beer and he gave some to my sister and she had some,  and they offered it to me.
zh: 他喝了一口啤酒，递给我妹妹，她也喝了 然后他们递给了我

en: I said, "No, no, no. That's okay. You all go ahead. I'm not going to have any beer."
zh: 我说：“我不要。没事，你们喝。我不喝。”

en: My brother said, "Come on. We're doing this today; you always do what we do.
zh: 我哥哥说：“来嘛，我们今个儿都喝。你老是和我们一条阵线的。

en: I had some, your sister had some. Have some beer."
zh: 我喝了点，妹妹也喝了点，你来些。”

en: I said, "No, I don't feel right about that. Y'all go ahead. Y'all go ahead."
zh: 我说：“不，我不想喝。你们喝你们喝。”

en: He said, "What's wrong with you? Have some beer."
zh: 问：“你有什么毛病？喝一点。”

en: Then he looked at me real hard and he said,  "Oh, I hope you're not still hung up  on that conversation Mama had with you."
zh: 接着他细细打量了我一会，问我： “噢，你不会还想着 姥姥要你保证的事吧。”

en: I was devastated.
zh: 我这个伤心呀

en: And I'm going to admit something to you.
zh: 现在我想向大家坦白一件事

en: I'm going to tell you something I probably shouldn't.
zh: 可能不该在这里说

en: I know this might be broadcast broadly.
zh: 因为这个演讲是会到处播的

en: I don't say that because I think that's virtuous;  I say that because there is power in identity.
zh: 这不是为了显派我多有道德 是为了说明自我定位的威力

en: When we create the right kind of identity,  we can say things to the world around us  that they don't actually believe makes sense.
zh: 当我们决定了正确的定位 我们就可以让全世界接受 他们本来想不到的事情

en: We can get them to do things  that they don't think they can do.
zh: 我们能让世界做 他们本来觉得做不到的事情

en: When I thought about my grandmother,  of course she would think all her grandkids were special.
zh: 当我想到我的外婆 她当然觉得每个外孙都很特别

en: And these were the things she thought we needed to commit to.
zh: 这些原则都是我外婆相信我们应该坚持的

en: than it was 40 years ago.
zh: 和四十年前比 这个国家变了很多

en: In 1972, there were 300,000 people in jails and prisons.
zh: 在1972年，监狱里只有三十万人

en: Today, there are 2.3 million.
zh: 今天，有两百三十万

en: In poor communities, in communities of color  there is this despair,  there is this hopelessness,  that is being shaped by these outcomes.
zh: 在贫穷的社区里，在有色人种社区里 充满了绝望 这样的绝望 是由这些改变带来的

en: Our system isn't just being shaped  in these ways that seem to be distorting around race,  they're also distorted by poverty.
zh: 我们的司法系统不仅是改变了 而是围绕着种族问题扭曲了 也围绕着贫困扭曲了

en: We have a system of justice in this country  that treats you much better  if you're rich and guilty than if you're poor and innocent.
zh: 这个国家的司法系统 会对你特殊照顾 如果你是有罪的富人而不是无辜的穷人的话

en: Wealth, not culpability,  shapes outcomes.
zh: 财富，而不是过失本身 决定了最终结果

en: The politics of fear and anger  have made us believe  that these are problems that are not our problems.
zh: 玩弄恐惧和愤怒的政治手腕 说服了我们 事不关己

en: We've been disconnected.
zh: 高高挂起

en: We're looking at some very interesting developments in our work.
zh: 我们日常工作能看一些很有意思的变革

en: My state of Alabama, like a number of states,  if you have a criminal conviction.
zh: 我所在的阿拉巴马州，像很多其他州一样 如果你被判有罪 就终身剥夺你的政治权力

en: We're actually projecting in another 10 years  will be as high as it's been  since prior to the passage of the Voting Rights Act.
zh: 我们向前看十年 这个剥夺政治权利的比例 将和投票权法案通过之前 一样的高

en: And there is this stunning silence.
zh: 可是没人提半个字

en: The United States is the only country in the world  where we sentence 13-year-old children  to die in prison.
zh: 美国是世界上唯一能将 十三岁的孩子 判成终身监禁的国家

en: We have life imprisonment without parole for kids in this country.
zh: 我国对孩子判终身监禁，还不得假释

en: It's interesting, this question of the death penalty.
zh: 死刑这件事很发人深省

en: And that's a very sensible question.
zh: 这是个非常合理的问题

en: But there's another way of thinking  about where we are in our identity.
zh: 但是另一方面 问题是我们的自我定位

en: The other way of thinking about it  is not, do people deserve to die for the crimes they commit,  but do we deserve to kill?
zh: 另一个想问题的方式 不是人们该不该为罪行偿命 而是我们配不配杀他们

en: I mean, it's fascinating.
zh: 我是说，这个问题非常震撼

en: For every nine people who have been executed,  we've actually identified one innocent person  who's been exonerated and released from death row.
zh: 每九个被判死刑的人 有一个后来会被证明无罪 被免死刑

en: I mean, it's fascinating.
zh: 我得说，非常震撼

en: In aviation, we would never let people fly on airplanes  if for every nine planes that took off  one would crash.
zh: 学航空的人知道，如果每九架飞机里 会有一架出事故 我们肯定是不会让这玩意儿载人飞的

en: But somehow we can insulate ourselves from this problem.
zh: 但是莫名其妙地我们就能忽视死刑的问题

en: I talk about race and this question  of whether we deserve to kill.
zh: 种族，还有 我们配不配执行死刑

en: And it's interesting, when I teach my students about African-American history,  I tell them about slavery.
zh: 这很发人深省。当我教美国黑人历史的时候 我和学生讲奴隶制

en: I tell them about terrorism,  the era that began at the end of reconstruction  that went on to World War II.
zh: 和他们讲恐怖主义 那个始于大复兴晚期 一直到二战时期的时代

en: We don't really know very much about it.
zh: 我们并不真的了解那段历史

en: They had to worry about being bombed.
zh: 人们担心随时会被炸弹袭击

en: It was the threat of terror that shaped their lives.
zh: 那个白色恐怖时代，改变了他们的生活

en: And these older people come up to me now  and they say, "Mr. Stevenson, you give talks, you make speeches,  you tell people to stop saying  we're dealing with terrorism for the first time in our nation's history  after 9/11."
zh: 那时的人现在上了年纪，来和我说 “史蒂文森先生，你到处演讲 你得告诉大家 别说什么911以后是我们美国有史以来 第一次对付恐怖主义。”

en: They tell me to say, "No, tell them that we grew up with that."
zh: 他们让我说：“我们就是在恐怖里长大的。”

en: And yet, we have in this country this dynamic  where we really don't like to talk about our problems.
zh: 然而，我们这个国家 不喜欢讨论存在的问题

en: We don't like to talk about our history.
zh: 我们不喜欢讨论历史

en: And because of that, we really haven't understood  what it's meant to do the things we've done historically.
zh: 正因如此，我们不能真正理解 我们有史以来做了什么

en: We're constantly creating tensions and conflicts.
zh: 不停地制造紧张气氛

en: We have a hard time talking about race,  and I believe it's because we are unwilling to commit ourselves  to a process of truth and reconciliation.
zh: 我们没法讨论种族问题 我相信是因为我们不愿意正视 一系列的事实，不愿意达成和解

en: In South Africa, people understood  that we couldn't overcome apartheid  without a commitment to truth and reconciliation.
zh: 在南非，人们知道 我们不能忘记种族隔离 除非我们诚实面对，达成和解

en: In Rwanda, even after the genocide, there was this commitment,  but in this country we haven't done that.
zh: 在卢旺达，即使种族灭绝后，人们还是正视了 但是在美国我们不愿意这么干

en: It was fascinating  because one of the scholars stood up after the presentation  and said, "Well you know it's deeply troubling  to hear what you're talking about."
zh: 结果很绝妙 因为在讲谈后有个学者站起来 说：“你要知道， 听你谈这个很痛心。”

en: And the room got very quiet,  and this woman said,  "There's no way, with our history,  we could ever engage  in the systematic killing of human beings.
zh: 全场肃静 这位女士说： “因为我们的历史， 我们永不可能决定 有系统地杀人。

en: It would be unconscionable for us  to, in an intentional and deliberate way,  set about executing people."
zh: 公开化且下意识地 执行死刑，对我们来说 是良心上无法接受的

en: And I thought about that.
zh: 我思考了这个问题

en: What would it feel like  to be living in a world  where the nation state of Germany was executing people,  especially if they were disproportionately Jewish?
zh: 如果我整天 都看着德国人杀人 毫无道理地屠杀犹太人 我会有什么感受？

en: I couldn't bear it.
zh: 我无法忍受

en: Well I believe that our identity is at risk.
zh: 我相信这说明我们有定位危机

en: That when we actually don't care  about these difficult things,  the positive and wonderful things  are nonetheless implicated.
zh: 当我们对这些棘手的问题 置之不顾时 我们却仍旧对那些正面的好事儿 一如既往地关心

en: And for me, it becomes necessary  to integrate the two.
zh: 对于我来说两者合一 是必要的

en: And for me that means  spending time thinking and talking  about the poor, the disadvantaged,  those who will never get to TED.
zh: 对于我来说那需要 花时间思考和讨论 穷人阶层，弱势群体 那些永远也没机会来TED的人

en: You know ultimately, we all have to believe things we haven't seen.
zh: 要知道最终，我们得相信那些没亲眼见的事

en: We do. As rational as we are, as committed to intellect as we are.
zh: 我们不得不。作为理智的社会，这么聪明的社会

en: They come from the ideas in our mind  that are also fueled  by some conviction in our heart.
zh: 它们是从我们脑子里的智慧 和我们心里的信念 相结合的产物

en: And it's that mind-heart connection  that I believe compels us  to not just be attentive  to all the bright and dazzly things,  but also the dark and difficult things.
zh: 这个灵智合一 我相信会驱使我们 不仅仅是对那些 光明的事情更上心 同时对那些黑暗面和棘手的事情也是一样

en: Vaclav Havel, the great Czech leader, talked about this.
zh: 韦克拉乌·哈韦尔，这位捷克的杰出领导人，谈过这个问题

en: He said, "When we were in Eastern Europe and dealing with oppression,  we wanted all kinds of things,  but mostly what we needed was hope,  an orientation of the spirit,  a willingness to sometimes be in hopeless places  and be a witness."
zh: 他说：“当我们在东欧解决强制压迫的问题时 我们希望能成就很多 但是最重要的，我们要一个希望 一个心灵的指向 一种不惮于体会绝望的态度 以及为史留证的意愿。”

en: There is no disconnect  around technology and design  that will allow us to be fully human  until we pay attention to suffering,  to poverty, to exclusion, to unfairness, to injustice.
zh: 这里不应有任何东西把 高新的科技和完美的设计 和我们的人性间隔开来 只要我们还能注意到痛苦 注意到贫穷，制约，不公，和冤屈

en: Now I will warn you  that this kind of identity  is a much more challenging identity  than ones that don't pay attention to this.
zh: 我想提醒大家 这样的定位 是很有挑战性的 比起那些漠不关心的定位来说

en: And Ms. Parks used to come back to Montgomery every now and then,  and she would get together with two of her dearest friends,  these older women,  Johnnie Carr who was the organizer  of the Montgomery bus boycott --  amazing African-American woman --  and Virginia Durr, a white woman,  whose husband, Clifford Durr, represented Dr. King.
zh: 帕克斯夫人曾时不时会到蒙哥马利 每次她都会和两个好友会面 两位上了年纪的女性 姜妮·卡尔，她是蒙哥马利 公车抵制运动的组织者—— 非常出色的黑人女性—— 还有弗吉尼亚·杜尔，一位白人女性 她丈夫克利福德·杜尔是马丁·路德·金的律师

en: And every now and then Ms. Carr would call me,  and she'd say, "Bryan, Ms. Parks is coming to town. We're going to get together and talk.
zh: 有时卡尔夫人会给我打电话 问我：“帕克斯夫人回来了，我们要聚聚。

en: Do you want to come over and listen?"
zh: 你愿不愿意来听我们谈话？”

en: And she'd say, "Well what are you going to do when you get here?"
zh: 她会问：“你来这里具体干什么呀？”

en: And I'd go over there and I would, I would just listen.
zh: 然后我会过去，只是倾听

en: It would be so energizing and so empowering.
zh: 这些聚会总是非常激动和鼓舞人心的

en: And one time I was over there listening to these women talk,  and after a couple of hours Ms. Parks turned to me  and she said, "Now Bryan, tell me what the Equal Justice Initiative is.
zh: 有一次我在那里听她们谈话 几小时后帕克斯夫人问我 她问：“布莱恩，和我讲讲你的平等司法倡议。

en: And I began giving her my rap.
zh: 我就开始大讲特讲

en: We're trying to help people who have been wrongly convicted.
zh: 我们想帮那些被误判了刑的人。

en: We're trying to end life without parole sentences for children.
zh: 给孩子被判终身无法假释的制度给终结掉。

en: We're trying to do something about the death penalty.
zh: 我们想为死刑制度做些改变。

en: I gave her my whole rap, and when I finished she looked at me  and she said, "Mmm mmm mmm."
zh: 我做了一个全本无删减的演讲，当我结束时，她盯着我 说：“别别别。”

en: And that's when Ms. Carr leaned forward, she put her finger in my face,  she said, "That's why you've got to be brave, brave, brave."
zh: 这时卡尔夫人凑过来，她把手放在我脸边说： “这就是为什么你要很勇敢很勇敢很勇敢。”

en: Because ultimately, our humanity depends  on everyone's humanity.
zh: 因为最终，我们的整体的人性取决于 每个人的人性

en: I've learned very simple things doing the work that I do.
zh: 在我的工作中

en: It's just taught me very simple things.
zh: 我学到了非常简单的原则

en: I've come to understand and to believe  that each of us  is more than the worst thing we've ever done.
zh: 我开始理解，开始相信 我们每一个人 都不会被我们最坏的一面所定义

en: I think if somebody tells a lie, they're not just a liar.
zh: 如果他撒了个谎，并不说明他就是个骗子

en: I think if somebody takes something that doesn't belong to them,  they're not just a thief.
zh: 如果他拿了不属于他的东西 并不说明他就是个惯偷

en: I think even if you kill someone, you're not just a killer.
zh: 甚至你杀了人，并不说明你就是个冷血杀手

en: And because of that there's this basic human dignity  that must be respected by law.
zh: 因为我相信人类有基本的尊严 法律必须尊重它

en: I also believe  that in many parts of this country,  and certainly in many parts of this globe,  that the opposite of poverty is not wealth.
zh: 我也相信 在我们国家的很多地方 当然甚至这个世界的很多地方 贫穷的反面，不是富裕

en: I don't believe that.
zh: 我不相信这个

en: And finally, I believe  that, despite the fact that it is so dramatic  and so beautiful and so inspiring  and so stimulating,  we will ultimately not be judged by our technology,  we won't be judged by our design,  we won't be judged by our intellect and reason.
zh: 最后，我相信 尽管很有声色 很美妙，很鼓动人心 也很刺激 但我们本身最终不会被科技所评价 也不会被设计所衡量 我们也不会被智慧和哲学来打分

en: Ultimately, you judge the character of a society,  not by how they treat their rich and the powerful and the privileged,  but by how they treat the poor,  the condemned, the incarcerated.
zh: 最终，人们会评价我们这个社会 不是根据我们怎么款待富人，有特权的人 而是根据我们怎么对待穷人 被谴责的人，被囚禁的人

en: Because it's in that nexus  that we actually begin to understand truly profound things  about who we are.
zh: 因为正是在这个合流点 我们真正地开始对于我们是什么样的人 有了深入的理解

en: I sometimes get out of balance. I'll end with this story.
zh: 我常失去平衡。我想用个故事结束我的演讲

en: I do get tired, as we all do.
zh: 很累，就像大家每个人一样

en: Sometimes those ideas get ahead of our thinking  in ways that are important.
zh: 有时这些想法太多而思考跟不上 结果是很严重的

en: And I go to the jail and I see my client who's 13 and 14,  and he's been certified to stand trial as an adult.
zh: 我去管教所，看见我的被告都是十三四岁 他们被说成是成年人，作为成年人对待

en: I start thinking, well, how did that happen?
zh: 我开始想，到底是怎么一回事？

en: How can a judge turn you into something  that you're not?
zh: 一个法官，怎么能够把一个人 判定成一个不同的人？

en: And I was up too late one night and I starting thinking,  well gosh, if the judge can turn you into something that you're not,  the judge must have magic power.
zh: 一天晚上我彻夜难眠，不止地想 天哪，如果法官能把你写成另一个人 这个法官肯定有魔法

en: You should ask for some of that.
zh: 你可得学着点

en: And I had a client who was 14 years old, a young, poor black kid.
zh: 我有个被告，十四岁，一个黑人小孩子

en: And I started working on this motion,  and the head of the motion was: "Motion to try my poor,  14-year-old black male client  like a privileged, white 75-year-old  corporate executive."
zh: 我开始做他的辩护 标题是：“提案：将我的 十四岁的穷黑孩子 想成一个七十五岁的特级 白人企业高管。”

en: And I put in my motion  that there was prosecutorial misconduct and police misconduct and judicial misconduct.
zh: 在这个提案里 我说检察院，警察局和法庭都处理不当

en: There was a crazy line in there about how there's no conduct in this county,  it's all misconduct.
zh: 说这个法院没有合情合法这一说之类的疯话 全是故意乱判

en: And the next morning, I woke up and I thought, now did I dream that crazy motion,  or did I actually write it?
zh: 第二天早上我醒来回想，我是做了个梦呢 还是真的写了这个提案？

en: And to my horror, not only had I written it,  but I had sent it to court.
zh: 恐怖的是，不光我真写了 我还寄给法院了

en: A couple months went by,  and I had just forgotten all about it.
zh: 几个月过去了 我全忘了有这么回事

en: And I got into my car  and I was feeling really overwhelmed -- overwhelmed.
zh: 我跳上车 觉得很紧张——非常紧张

en: And I got in my car and I went to this courthouse.
zh: 我上车开到法庭

en: And I finally got out of the car and I started walking up to the courthouse.
zh: 最后我终于钻出车子，开始往法庭走

en: And as I was walking up the steps of this courthouse,  there was an older black man who was the janitor in this courthouse.
zh: 当我上台阶时 有个上了年纪的黑人老伯，法院的清洁工

en: When this man saw me, he came over to me  and he said, "Who are you?"
zh: 他看见我，跑来说 他问：“你是谁？”

en: And this man came over to me  and he hugged me.
zh: 这个老伯凑过来 给了我一个拥抱

en: And I have to tell you,  it was energizing.
zh: 我得和大家承认 这可给了我一针强心剂

en: It connected deeply with something in me  about identity,  about the capacity of every person to contribute  to a community, to a perspective that is hopeful.
zh: 他的话提醒了我心深处 我的自我定位 提醒了我每个人都应该 对社会，对更好的前景做出的贡献

en: He said, "Mr. Stevenson, did you write this crazy motion?"
zh: “史蒂文森先生，是你写了这个疯案么？”

en: And before I knew it, the courtroom was filled with people  angry that we were talking about race,  that we were talking about poverty,  that we were talking about inequality.
zh: 我还没回过神来，整个法庭站满了人 全很愤怒，因为我们在谈种族问题 我们在谈贫穷 我们在谈不平等待遇

en: And out of the corner of my eye, I could see this janitor pacing back and forth.
zh: 我眼角瞟到那个清洁工，在外面走来走去

en: And he kept looking through the window, and he could hear all of this holler.
zh: 不断向里张望，他也都能听到人们的抱怨

en: And finally, this older black man with this very worried look on his face  came into the courtroom and sat down behind me,  almost at counsel table.
zh: 最后，这个黑人老伯进来了 一脸担心地坐在我后面 几乎顶到了辩护台

en: About 10 minutes later the judge said we would take a break.
zh: 十分钟后，法官提议休息一下

en: And during the break there was a deputy sheriff who was offended  that the janitor had come into court.
zh: 休息期间，一个副警长觉得清洁工进法庭 有失面子

en: And this deputy jumped up and he ran over to this older black man.
zh: 这个副警长跳起来，向这个老伯冲过去

en: He said, "Jimmy, what are you doing in this courtroom?"
zh: 说：“吉米，你来法庭里干什么？”

en: And this older black man stood up  and he looked at that deputy and he looked at me  and he said, "I came into this courtroom  to tell this young man,  keep your eyes on the prize, hold on."
zh: 这个老黑人站起来 看看这个副警长，看看我 他说：“我进来 是想告诉这个年轻人 往前看，往好了看，挺住。”

en: I've come to TED  because I believe that many of you understand  that the moral arc of the universe is long,  but it bends toward justice.
zh: 我今天来TED 是因为我相信这里很多人都明白 这个世界的道德的弧线尽管很长 但是永远向着公正的一边倾斜

en: until we care about human rights and basic dignity.
zh: 在我们开始关心人权和尊严之前 我们无法真正完成进化

en: That all of our survival  is tied to the survival of everyone.
zh: 我们的生存 和每一个人的生存都分不开

en: And more than anything,  for those of you who share that,  I've simply come to tell you  to keep your eyes on the prize, hold on.
zh: 相结合 最重要的是 对于每个执着此见的人 我只想和你说 往前看，往好了看，挺住

en: Chris Anderson: So you heard and saw  an obvious desire by this audience, this community,  to help you on your way and to do something on this issue.
zh: 克里斯·安德森：你应该听到看到 这些听众，这个群体 想帮你，想做贡献的意愿了

en: Other than writing a check,  what could we do?
zh: 除了给你写支票 我们还能做什么？

en: BS: Well there are opportunities all around us.
zh: 布莱恩：有很多机会

en: If you live in the state of California, for example,  there's a referendum coming up this spring  where actually there's going to be an effort  to redirect some of the money we spend on the politics of punishment.
zh: 比如，如果你在加州住 今年春天有个公投 将是个很大的工夫 关于重新分配我们在惩戒人上花的钱

en: So there's an opportunity to change that.
zh: 这个公投是个改变现状的机会

en: CA: There's been this huge decline  in crime in America over the last three decades.
zh: 克瑞斯：在近三十年 美国的犯罪率有个大下降

en: And part of the narrative of that  is sometimes that it's about increased incarceration rates.
zh: 有人说部分原因是 和大幅上升的监禁率有关

en: What would you say to someone who believed that?
zh: 你对持这个说法的人会怎么讲？

en: It was this misguided war on drugs.
zh: 而是由毒品的滥用所导致的

en: And so we have three strikes laws  that put people in prison forever  for stealing a bicycle, for low-level property crimes,  rather than making them give those resources back  to the people who they victimized.
zh: 同时我们有三击出局的规定 能把一些人永久监禁起来 只是因为偷了辆自行车，或者一点点财物 我们并不给他们机会对受害人 作出补偿

en: And I think our current punishment philosophy  does nothing for no one.
zh: 我想现今的刑法哲学 对谁也没有利

en: And I think that's the orientation that we have to change.
zh: 我认为这个大方向应该改变

en: CA: Bryan, you've struck a massive chord here.
zh: 克里斯：布莱恩，你今天震了大家一把

en: Thank you so much for coming to TED. Thank you.
zh: 非常感谢你来TED。谢谢

en: Peter Diamandis: So those are just a few of the clips  I collected over the last six months --  could have easily been the last six days  or the last six years.
zh: 彼得迪曼蒂斯：这是我在过去6个月里 收集的一些视频。 如果是在6天，或者过去6年里 也可以轻易收集到类似的片段。

en: The point is that the news media  preferentially feeds us negative stories  because that's what our minds pay attention to.
zh: 重点是新闻媒体倾向于 向我们灌输负面信息。 因为我们的大脑特别容易关注这些。

en: And there's a very good reason for that.
zh: 当然大脑这样做是有很重要的理由。

en: Every second of every day,  our senses bring in way too much data  than we can possibly process in our brains.
zh: 每时每刻， 我们的“传感器”收集大量的信息 多到我们的大脑处理不过来。

en: And because nothing is more important to us  than survival,  the first stop of all of that data  is an ancient sliver of the temporal lobe  called the amygdala.
zh: 而其中没有比与生存相关的信息 更重要的。 所有信息输入的第一站就是 颞叶上一个叫做大脑扁桃体的 非常原始的部分。

en: Now the amygdala is our early warning detector,  our danger detector.
zh: 大脑扁桃体是我们的早期预警侦测器， 危险探测仪。

en: It sorts and scours through all of the information  looking for anything in the environment that might harm us.
zh: 它将所有信息分类并仔细查阅， 探测环境中任何可能的威胁。

en: And that old newspaper saying,  "If it bleeds it leads,"  is very true.
zh: 那个过去有关报纸的说法： ”流血事件必上头条。“ 其实是很有道理的。

en: So given all of our digital devices  that are bringing all the negative news to us  it's no wonder that we're pessimistic.
zh: 而现在我们有各种数字化设备， 无时无刻地向我们 输送各种负面新闻。 难怪大家这么容易悲观。

en: It's no wonder that people think  that the world is getting worse.
zh: 难怪人们觉得 世界在倒退。

en: But perhaps that's not the case.
zh: 但事实或许

en: Perhaps instead,  it's the distortions brought to us  of what's really going on.
zh: 并不是这样， 我们所接受的信息 是被扭曲的。

en: Now I'm not saying  we don't have our set of problems --  climate crisis, species extinction,  water and energy shortage -- we surely do.
zh: 我并不是说 这些问题不存在－ 气候危机，物种灭绝， 水资源和能源短缺的情况都确实发生了。

en: And we keep setting our expectations higher and higher.
zh: 我们不断地把期望越定越高。

en: In fact, we redefine what poverty means.
zh: 事实上，我们已经更改了“贫穷”的涵义。

en: Think of this, in America today,  the majority of people under the poverty line  still have electricity, water, toilets, refrigerators,  television, mobile phones,  air conditioning and cars.
zh: 想一下，在今天的美国 大部分生活在贫困线下的人 仍然拥有电力，饮用水，厕所，冰箱， 电视，行动电话， 空调和汽车。

en: The wealthiest robber barons of the last century, the emperors on this planet,  could have never dreamed of such luxuries.
zh: 上世纪最富有的强盗大亨，这个星球上的帝王们， 永远都想象不到这样的奢侈生活。

en: My good friend Ray Kurzweil  showed that any tool that becomes an information technology  jumps on this curve, on Moore's Law,  and experiences price performance doubling  every 12 to 24 months.
zh: 我的好朋友雷·库兹威尔 展示了任何信息科技的工具 都遵从这条曲线，即摩尔定律。 并经历每12到24个月 性价比翻一倍的增长。

en: That's why the cellphone in your pocket  is literally a million times cheaper and a thousand times faster  than a supercomputer of the '70s.
zh: 这就是为什么你口袋里的行动电话 相比70年代的超级电脑要便宜 100万倍，而且还要快上1000倍

en: This is Moore's Law over the last hundred years.
zh: 这是过去几百年里的摩尔定律。

en: This is the result of faster computers  being used to build faster computers.
zh: 这是因为更快的电脑被用来制造 更更快的电脑所产生的结果。

en: It doesn't slow for any of our grand challenges.
zh: 它不会因为我们面临的巨大挑战所延缓。

en: And also, even though it's plotted  on a log curve on the left,  it's curving upwards.
zh: 尽管在左边 呈现出对数曲线 它也是仍然是向上弯曲。

en: The rate at which the technology is getting faster  is itself getting faster.
zh: 科技前进加速的本身 也在不断变快。

en: And on this curve, riding on Moore's Law,  are a set of extraordinarily powerful technologies  available to all of us.
zh: 在这摩尔定律的曲线上， 是一系列对所有人都开放 的强大的科技。

en: Cloud computing,  what my friends at Autodesk call infinite computing;  sensors and networks; robotics;  3D printing, which is the ability to democratize and distribute  personalized production around the planet;  synthetic biology;  fuels, vaccines and foods;  digital medicine; nanomaterials; and A.I.
zh: 云计算， 我在Autodesk公司的朋友称之为无限计算； 传感器和网络，机器人； 3D打印，让我们获得在全世界范围普及和部署 个性化生产的能力； 人造生命； 带来新的燃料，疫苗和食物； 数字化医药；纳米材料和人工智能。

en: I mean, how many of you saw the winning of Jeopardy  by IBM's Watson?
zh: 观众中多少人看到了IBM的Watson超级电脑在 Jeopardy智力竞赛的获胜？

en: I mean, that was epic.
zh: 那真是太伟大了。

en: And I love this: "Watson Vanquishes Human Opponents."
zh: 我喜欢这句：”Watson征服人类对手。“

en: It's about the nuance of human language.
zh: 获胜关键在于理解人类语言中的微妙细节。

en: And we teach our students all of these technologies,  and particularly how they can be used  to solve humanity's grand challenges.
zh: 我们教给学生各种科技 特别是如何利用这些科技 来解决人类面临的巨大挑战。

en: And every year we ask them  to start a company or a product or a service  that can affect positively the lives of a billion people  within a decade.
zh: 每一年我们都要求学生 创立一件公司或制作一种产品或者提供一项服务 能在十年内对十亿人的生活产生 积极而实际的影响。

en: Think about that, the fact that, literally, a group of students  can touch the lives of a billion people today.
zh: 想象一下一群学生 今天可以影响到十亿人的生活。

en: Today we can point at dozens of companies  that have done just that.
zh: 今天我们可以列举出几十间 有这样成就的公司。

en: When I think about creating abundance,  it's not about creating a life of luxury for everybody on this planet;  it's about creating a life of possibility.
zh: 当我想到创造富足社会， 并不是要为地球上的每一个人创造奢华的生活； 而是创造充满可能性的生活。

en: It is about taking that which was scarce  and making it abundant.
zh: 是把原先稀缺的资源 变得充沛

en: You see, scarcity is contextual,  and technology is a resource-liberating force.
zh: 稀缺性是相对的， 而科技是一股解放资源的力量。

en: Let me give you an example.
zh: 我来举一个例子。

en: So this is a story of Napoleon III  in the mid-1800s.
zh: 这是一个拿破仑三世的故事 在1800到1810年中期。

en: He's the dude on the left.
zh: 他是左边这位

en: He invited over to dinner  the king of Siam.
zh: 邀请了泰王 共进晚餐。

en: All of Napoleon's troops  were fed with silver utensils,  Napoleon himself with gold utensils.
zh: 所有拿破仑的士兵 使用银器用餐， 拿破仑自己则使用金器。

en: But the King of Siam,  he was fed with aluminum utensils.
zh: 但是泰国国王 使用铝制的餐具。

en: You see, aluminum  was the most valuable metal on the planet,  worth more than gold and platinum.
zh: 铝 曾经是世界上最贵重的金属， 比黄金和白金还要昂贵。

en: It's the reason that the tip of the Washington Monument  is made of aluminum.
zh: 这就是为什么华盛顿纪念碑的 顶端是铝制的。

en: You see, even though aluminum  is 8.3 percent of the Earth by mass,  it doesn't come as a pure metal.
zh: 即使铝占了地球 总重量的8.3%。 但它不是以纯金属的形态存在。

en: It's all bound by oxygen and silicates.
zh: 它都是和氧或者硅酸结合。

en: But then the technology of electrolysis came along  and literally made aluminum so cheap  that we use it with throw-away mentality.
zh: 但是随后出现了电解技术 使得铝的价格如此低廉 以致我们就把铝制品当一次性用品般看待。

en: Ladies and gentlemen,  we are on a planet  that is bathed with 5,000 times more energy  than we use in a year.
zh: 女士们先生们， 我们生活的这个星球上 接收着相当于我们年平均能源消耗 5000多倍的能量。

en: It's not about being scarce,  it's about accessibility.
zh: 问题并不是能源稀缺， 而是可及性。

en: And there's good news here.
zh: 现在有几个好消息，

en: For the first time, this year  the cost of solar-generated electricity  is 50 percent that of diesel-generated electricity in India --  8.8 rupees versus 17 rupees.
zh: 今年是有史以来第一次 在印度，太阳能发电的成本降低至 化石燃料发电成本的一半-- 8.8卢布相比较17卢布。

en: And if we have abundant energy,  we also have abundant water.
zh: 如果我们有充足的能源， 也就会有丰富的洁净水。

en: Do you remember  when Carl Sagan turned the Voyager spacecraft  back towards the Earth,  in 1990 after it just passed Saturn?
zh: 还记得吗？ 1990年，Carl Saga在航海者太空飞船 经过土星的时候， 调转其方向面对地球。

en: He took a famous photo. What was it called?
zh: 拍下了一幅著名的照片，叫什么名字？

en: We live on a planet 70 percent covered by water.
zh: 地球表面70％被水覆盖

en: And there is technology coming online,  not 10, 20 years from now,  right now.
zh: 有一项科技正准备投入应用， 并不是未来的10年20年以后， 就是现在。

en: There's nanotechnology coming on, nanomaterials.
zh: 有一种纳米科技。

en: And the conversation I had with Dean Kamen this morning,  one of the great DIY innovators,  I'd like to share with you -- he gave me permission to do so --  his technology called Slingshot  that many of you may have heard of,  it is the size of a small dorm room refrigerator.
zh: 今天早上我和一个伟大的DIY 发明家Dean Kamen聊天。 我想要和大家分享－我得到了他的允许－ 他开发的技术叫做“弹弓” 在座的一些朋友可能听说过， 它是一个小房间一般大的冰箱，

en: The chairman of Coca-Cola has just agreed  to do a major test  of hundreds of units of this in the developing world.
zh: 可口可乐的主席最近授意 在多个发展中国家对 数百台“弹弓”进行大规模测试。

en: And if that pans out,  which I have every confidence it will,  Coca-Cola will deploy this globally  to 206 countries  around the planet.
zh: 如果测试成功， 我很有信心它会成功， 可口可乐将会在全球206个国家 对该设备 进行部署。

en: This is the kind of innovation, empowered by this technology,  that exists today.
zh: 这就是当下已经存在的由科技 驱动的创新。

en: My goodness, we're going to hit 70 percent penetration  of cellphones in the developing world  by the end of 2013.
zh: 我的天哪，在2013年底，发展中国家的 移动电话渗透率将 达到70％。

en: Think about it,  that a Masai warrior on a cellphone in the middle of Kenya  than President Reagan did 25 years ago.
zh: 想象一下。 在肯尼亚中部的一个马赛士兵 拥有的比25年前的里根总统 更好的移动通讯。

en: They're living in a world of information and communication abundance  that no one could have ever predicted.
zh: 所得到的更多的知识和信息。 他们生活在一个信息和通讯富足的世界 这在过去没人能预测到的。

en: Better than that,  the things that you and I  spent tens and hundreds of thousands of dollars for --  GPS, HD video and still images,  libraries of books and music,  medical diagnostic technology --  are now literally dematerializing and demonetizing  into your cellphone.
zh: 还有更棒的， 我们花费了 成千上百美金所获得的－ GPS，高清电视和 图形图像， 以及医疗诊断技术－ 被非物质化并非商业化 输入到你的行动电话中。

en: Probably the best part of it  is what's coming down the pike in health.
zh: 这其中最好的 部分或许是医疗。

en: Last month, I had the pleasure of announcing with Qualcomm Foundation  something called the $10 million Qualcomm Tricorder X Prize.
zh: 上个月我很荣幸和高通基金共同宣布 1000万美金高通手持移动分析仪X大赛。

en: We're challenging teams around the world  to basically combine these technologies  into a mobile device  that you can speak to, because it's got A.I.,  you can cough on it, you can do a finger blood prick.
zh: 我们向全世界的团队发出挑战 来将这些科技 组合进移动设备。 你可以向它说话，因为它拥有人工智能 也可以对着它咳嗽，或者扎手指验血。

en: And to win, it needs to be able to diagnose you better  than a team of board-certified doctors.
zh: 要赢得竞赛，这个设备需要能为你提供比一组 经过委员会验证的医师更好的诊断。

en: So literally, imagine this device  in the middle of the developing world where there are no doctors, 25 percent of the disease burden  and 1.3 percent of the health care workers.
zh: 想象这个设备 应用在缺少医师，25％的疾病负担 仅有1.3%的医疗人员 的发展中国家。

en: When this device sequences an RNA or DNA virus  that it doesn't recognize,  it calls the CDC  and prevents the pandemic from happening in the first place.
zh: 如果这个设备对病毒的RNA或者DNA进行测序后 无法识别， 它会呼叫疾病控制中心 第一时间防止大规模疫情的爆发。

en: I call it the rising billion.
zh: 我称之为“崛起的十亿人”。

en: We just passed the seven billion mark on Earth.
zh: 地球上的人口最近超过了70亿。

en: By 2020,  that's going from two billion to five billion  Internet users.
zh: 到2020年， 英特网用户将会从20亿 增长到50亿。

en: Three billion new minds  who have never been heard from before  are connecting to the global conversation.
zh: 30亿未曾 被注意的新用户。 将参与到这全球的对话中来。

en: What will these people want?
zh: 他们想要什么？

en: And they will get healthier  and they'll become better educated by using the Khan Academy,  3D printing and infinite computing  [become] more productive than ever before.
zh: 他们会因为使用手持移动分析仪 而更健康， 也会因为观看Khan Academy变得更有聪慧， 随着3D打印和无限计算 的普及而变得比以往 任何时代都更有生产力。

en: What about giving the oppressed,  wherever they might be,  the voice to be heard and the voice to act  for the first time ever?
zh: 还有给予受到压制的， 或者其他困难的 人们首次获得受到关注 和帮助的机会。

en: What about contributions we can't even predict?
zh: 或许是我们都还未能预见的贡献？

en: The one thing I've learned at the X Prize  driven by their passion with a clear focus  can do extraordinary things,  things that large corporations and governments  could only do in the past.
zh: 我在筹办X大赛的过程中体会到的一点是 目标清晰，富有激情的 小型团队就能取得 卓越的成就， 在过去只有大企业和政府 才能做到的事情。

en: Let me share and close with a story  that really got me excited.
zh: 让我来分享一个故事作为结尾， 这个故事让我非常兴奋。

en: There is a program that some of you might have heard of.
zh: 在座的有一些可能听说过这个项目。

en: It's a game called Foldit.
zh: 是一个叫做Foldit的游戏。

en: And how it folds dictates its structure and its functionality.
zh: 其折叠的方式决定了该氨基酸的结构和功能。

en: And it's very important for research in medicine.
zh: 这是非常重要的医学研究。

en: And it's literally, hundreds of thousands of people  came online and started playing it.
zh: 然后成百上千的人也上线 开始玩这个游戏。

en: And when these individuals went and looked  at who was the best protein folder in the world,  it wasn't an MIT professor,  it wasn't a CalTech student,  it was a person from England, from Manchester,  a woman who, during the day,  was an executive assistant at a rehab clinic  and, at night, was the world's best protein folder.
zh: 当大家排列出最好的 蛋白质折叠专家时， 并不是MIT的教授， 也不是加州理工学院的学生， 而是一位来自曼彻斯特的英国女性。 白天在一家康复治疗整所 行政助理的工作， 而夜晚也是全世界最好的蛋白质折叠专家。

en: Ladies and gentlemen,  what gives me tremendous confidence  in the future  is the fact that we are now more empowered as individuals  to take on the grand challenges of this planet.
zh: 女士们先生们 给予我对未来 巨大信心的， 是我们每一位作为个人都被赋予 挑战全世界面临的难题的能力。

en: We have the passion of the DIY innovator.
zh: 也有DIY发明家的激情。

en: And we have three billion new minds  coming online to work with us  to solve the grand challenges,  to do that which we must do.
zh: 同时还有30亿新的用户 来到线上与我们合作 一起解决巨大的挑战， 做到我们必须要做的事情。

en: And this is about shifting baseline.
zh: 与基准线的变动有关

en: And because the idea can be explained in one minute,  I will tell you three stories before  to fill in the time.
zh: 这个概念一分钟就能讲完了 所以我先讲三个故事 来混时间

en: And he was here, as you well know, in '35.
zh: 他曾来过这里 大家都知道 那是1935年

en: And you'd think he was chasing finches,  but he wasn't.
zh: 你们可能以为他在追鸟雀 其实不是

en: And he described one of them  as very "common."
zh: 他说一条鱼 很”常见“

en: This was the sailfin grouper.
zh: 这是一种石斑鱼

en: A big fishery was run on it  until the '80s.
zh: 这种鱼被大量捕捉 到八十年代

en: Now this story,  we have heard it lots of times  on Galapagos and other places,  so there is nothing particular about it.
zh: 这个故事 我们已经听过很多遍了 在加拉帕戈斯群岛和其他地方都听过 没什么新鲜的

en: We still think it is pristine.
zh: 还认为那是还是原生态

en: Because I was there in '71,  studying a lagoon in West Africa.
zh: （众人笑） 1971年的时候 我在那里 考察西非的一片西湖

en: I was there because I grew up in Europe  and I wanted later to work in Africa.
zh: 我去那里是因为我在欧洲长大 我想以后到非洲工作

en: And the fish also were happy to be there.
zh: 鱼儿们也很喜欢生活在那里

en: So nothing has changed,  but everything has changed.
zh: 似乎没什么变化 但其实 一切都改变了

en: My third little story  is that I was an accomplice  in the introduction of trawling  in Southeast Asia.
zh: 第三个故事讲的是 将拖网捕捞 引入非洲东南部的 有我一份

en: Fish development  meant imposing on countries  that had already 100,000 fishers  to impose on them industrial fishing.
zh: 渔业发展 意味着强迫 渔民人数在达十万人的国家 进行工业捕鱼

en: And I went sailing on it,  and we did surveys  throughout the southern South China sea  and especially the Java Sea.
zh: 我乘上这艘船 我们一路做调查 沿着中国南海 尤其是爪哇海

en: And what we caught,  we didn't have words for it.
zh: 我们捕捞到了 叫不出名字的东西

en: What we caught, I know now,  is the bottom of the sea.
zh: 现在我知道了 我们捞到的 是海底的生物

en: And 90 percent of our catch  were sponges,  other animals that are fixed on the bottom.
zh: 百分之九十 是海绵 以及其他固定在海底的动物

en: This is a dead turtle.
zh: 这是一只死了的海龟

en: They were not eaten, they were thrown away because they were dead.
zh: 它们没有被吃掉 而是因为死了而被扔掉的

en: And then they wanted to kill it because it was good to eat.
zh: 他们想杀掉它 因为海龟肉很美味

en: We transform the world,  but we don't remember it.
zh: 我们改变了世界 但却不认账

en: We adjust our baseline  to the new level,  and we don't recall what was there.
zh: 我们把基准线 调整到一个新水平 而把之前的水平抛在脑后

en: If you generalize this,  something like this happens.
zh: 归纳一下 就会出现这样的情况

en: You have on the y axis some good thing:  biodiversity, numbers of orca,  the greenness of your country, the water supply.
zh: Y轴代表美好的事物 生物多样性 逆戟鲸的数量 你的国家的绿化 水资源供应

en: And over time it changes --  it changes  because people do things, or naturally.
zh: 随着时间的变化而变化 之所以变化 是因为人们的活动或自然的变化

en: Every generation  will use the images  that they got at the beginning of their conscious lives  as a standard  and will extrapolate forward.
zh: 每代人 都会 以他们有意识之初的画面 作为标准 并往前推测

en: But they don't perceive what happened before as a loss.
zh: 但他们没有把之前发生的事情视为一种损失

en: You can have a succession of changes.
zh: 一系列变化发生了

en: And that, to a large extent, is what we want to do now.
zh: 而这在很大程度上 就是我们现在要做的

en: We want to sustain things that are gone  or things that are not the way they were.
zh: 我们想要保护那些消失殆尽的东西 或者那些发生了变化的东西

en: Now one should think  this problem affected people certainly when in predatory societies,  they killed animals  after a few generations.
zh: 现在人们应当认为 这个问题当然会对人产生影响 他们捕杀动物 而直到几代人之后

en: Because, obviously,  an animal that is very abundant,  before it gets extinct,  it becomes rare.
zh: 才意识到他们的所作所为 因为 很显然 在一种动物灭绝 或濒临灭绝前 这种动物的数量还是很多的

en: And therefore they're not perceived  as a big loss.
zh: 所以这些动物的消失 不会被视为重大损失

en: They become rarer because we fish them.
zh: 我们捕捞鱼类致使它们的数量越来越少

en: Over time we have a few fish left  and we think this is the baseline.
zh: 一段时间时候 我们只剩下少数鱼了 我们就把这个数量看做基准线

en: And the question is,  why do people accept this?
zh: 问题是 人们为什么对此安之若素呢

en: Well because they don't know that it was different.
zh: 这是因为他们不知道情况变化了

en: And in fact, lots of people, scientists,  will contest that it was really different.
zh: 事实上 许多人 尤其是科学家 反对这种意见

en: And they will contest this  because the evidence  presented in an earlier mode  is not in the way  they would like the evidence presented.
zh: 他们反对 是因为 早前的分析模型中所呈现的证据方式 并不是 他们想要的呈现方式

en: So you have a situation  where people don't know the past,  even though we live in literate societies,  because they don't trust  the sources of the past.
zh: 这就造成了一个情况： 人们对过去一无所知 尽管 我们生活在文明社会中 因为他们不相信 关于过去的信息来源

en: And hence, the enormous role  that a marine protected area can play.
zh: 他们也不了解 一个海洋保护区域的重大角色

en: That is for people  who can see a marine protected area  and who can benefit  from the insight that it provides,  which enables them to reset their baseline.
zh: 这适用于 那些看到一片海洋保护区的人 和那些 从其中的深层意义获益的人 这让他们有能力重置他们的基准线

en: How about the people who can't do that  because they have no access --  the people in the Midwest for example?
zh: 那么那些没有能力这么做的人呢 他们没法知道 例如中西部地区的人们

en: This is a simulation of Chesapeake Bay.
zh: 这是切萨皮克湾的原态模拟

en: And if you think about "Avatar,"  if you think of why people were so touched by it --  never mind the Pocahontas story --  why so touched by the imagery?
zh: （众人笑） 一想到“阿凡达” 一想到人们为何会为之动容 风中奇缘的故事就不说了 为何人们会被里面的画面所打动

en: It's true.
zh: 这是真的。

en: We all want to be stars --  celebrities, singers, comedians --  and when I was younger, that seemed so very, very hard to do.
zh: 我们都想成为明星 -- 名人， 歌手， 喜剧演员 -- 而当我年轻时，这是非常，非常难办到的。

en: But now Web video has made it  so that any of us or any of the creative things that we do  can become completely famous  in a part of our world's culture.
zh: 不过现在网络视频让它成真 所以我们任何人都可以发挥创意做想做的事 然后瞬间成名 成为世界文化的一部分。

en: But there are over 48 hours of video uploaded to YouTube  every minute.
zh: 不过每分钟有超过48小时的视频 上传到YouTube。

en: And of that, only a tiny percentage  ever goes viral and gets tons of views and becomes a cultural moment.
zh: 在众多中， 仅有极小比率 会风靡及得到万人收看率，并成为一种霎时文化。

en: KA: Last year, Bear Vasquez posted this video  that he had shot outside his home in Yosemite National Park.
zh: KA: 去年，熊先生 · 瓦斯奎兹上传了这视频 就在他优胜美地公园的住家外拍摄的。

en: In 2010, it was viewed 23 million times.
zh: 在2010年，这部视频被观看了两千三百万次。

en: This is a chart of what it looked like  when it first became popular last summer.
zh: (笑声） 这张图表显示了 这部视频刚在夏末流行的状况。

en: But he didn't actually set out to make a viral video, Bear.
zh: 不过熊先生并没有要拍风靡视频的意向。

en: Because that's what you do when your name is Yosemite Mountain Bear.
zh: 因为这正是自称“优胜美地山熊”的人会做的事。

en: So what happened here?
zh: 所以之间到底是发生了什么事？

en: Jimmy Kimmel posted this tweet  that would eventually propel the video to be as popular as it would become.
zh: 吉米·吉梅尔一则推文 推波助澜让这个视频大受欢迎。

en: Because tastemakers like Jimmy Kimmel  introduce us to new and interesting things  and bring them to a larger audience.
zh: 因为有像吉米·吉梅尔这种潮流先锋 为我们介绍新颖又有趣的事物 从而让观众接触到这些事物。

en: Rebecca Black: ♫ It's Friday, Friday. Gotta get down on Friday. ♫  ♫ Everybody's looking forward to the weekend, weekend. ♫  ♫ Friday, Friday. Gettin' down on Friday. ♫  KA: So you didn't think that we could actually have this conversation  without talking about this video I hope.
zh: 丽贝卡·布莱克：♫今天是周五，周五。玩乐派对在周五。♫ ♫每个人都期待着过周末，周末。♫ ♫周五，周五。玩乐在周五。♫ 凯文：如果没有这部视频，你未必能想到 我们将有接下来这场谈论。

en: It's been seen nearly 200 million times this year.
zh: 今年吸引了将近两亿的观看次数。

en: This is a chart of what it looked like.
zh: 这张图表展现了它流行的趋势。

en: So what happened on this day?
zh: 那天究竟发生什么事情呢？

en: Well it was a Friday, this is true.
zh: 噢，就是那天，一个周五，真的。

en: And if you're wondering about those other spikes, those are also Fridays.
zh: 如果你疑惑那些高峰时期，那些全是在周五。

en: Michael J. Nelson from Mystery Science Theater  was one of the first people to post a joke about the video on Twitter.
zh: 奥秘科学剧院（电视节目)的迈克尔·约翰·纳尔逊 率先在他的推特上嘲弄这部视频。

en: But what's important is that an individual or a group of tastemakers  took a point of view  and they shared that with a larger audience, accelerating the process.
zh: 重点有这样一个或一群潮流先锋 看了视频后 跟广大观众分享他们的观点，加速整个视频窜红。

en: And so then this community formed  of people who shared this big inside joke  and they started talking about it and doing things with it.
zh: 而这个群体形成 共享笑话并不断分享， 不但会讨论它，还会恶搞出自己的版本。

en: And now there are 10,000 parodies of "Friday" on YouTube.
zh: 所以现在有上万个恶搞版"周五”在YouTube上传播。

en: Even in the first seven days,  there was one parody for every other day of the week.
zh: 就连周一至周末 都有不同的滑稽模仿。

en: Unlike the one-way entertainment of the 20th century,  this community participation  is how we become a part of the phenomenon --  either by spreading it or by doing something new with it.
zh: 不像二十世纪的单向娱乐媒体， 这是一个集体参与 从而让我们成为全民现象一部分-- 通过传播或者自主创新。

en: It's this, just like this.
zh: 就是这个，只是这样。

en: It's been viewed nearly 50 million times this year.
zh: 今年被观看次数多达五千万次。

en: And if you think that that is weird,  you should know that there is a three-hour version of this  that's been viewed four million times.
zh: 假如你觉得这个是不可思议， 你就更难想象这段视频还有三小时的版本 吸引了四百万人观看。

en: But what's important here  is the creativity that it inspired  amongst this techie, geeky Internet culture.
zh: 但这最重要的 是激发了创意 的这种科技，极客网络文化。

en: There were remixes.
zh: 还制作了混音版。

en: Someone made an old timey version.
zh: 有人还制作了怀旧版。

en: And then it went international.
zh: 然后走国际版路线。

en: An entire remix community sprouted up  that brought it from being just a stupid joke  to something that we can all actually be a part of.
zh: 整个混音群窜红 让这个原本只是个愚弄笑话 变成大家都可以参与创作的玩意。

en: And who could have predicted any of this?
zh: 有谁能料到这一切呢？

en: What scripts could you have written  that would have contained this in it?
zh: 你会写怎样的剧本 会在里面包含这些创作？

en: In a world where over two days of video  get uploaded every minute,  only that which is truly unique and unexpected  can stand out in the way that these things have.
zh: 在这个每分钟就上传足够两天 观看的网络视频世界， 只有那些独特和难以想象的视频 才能引人关注。

en: When a friend of mine told me that I needed to see this great video  about a guy protesting bicycle fines in New York City,  I admit I wasn't very interested.
zh: 我的一个朋友大力推荐一段很赞的视频 是一个抗议纽约市单车罚款的人拍的， 我得承认我原本没什么兴趣。

en: Casey Niestat: So I got a ticket for not riding in the bike lane,  but often there are obstructions  that keep you from properly riding in the bike lane.
zh: 凯西·尼塞特：我吃了一张罚单，因为我没在自行车道上骑车， 不过常常因为许多障碍 让你根本没法在自行车道上好好骑车。

en: And so this approach holds  for anything new that we do creatively.
zh: 这种方式适用于 我们创新的每一件事上。

en: And so it all brings us  to one big question ...
zh: 所以促使我们 有这样一个问题...

en: KA: What does it mean?
zh: 凯文：这意味什么？

en: Tastemakers, creative participating communities,  complete unexpectedness,  these are characteristics of a new kind of media and a new kind of culture  where anyone has access  and the audience defines the popularity.
zh: 潮流先锋，创意参与团体， 以及怪咖， 这些是新媒体和新文化的特征 在其中人人能参与 让观众定义何为流行。

en: I mean, as mentioned earlier,  one of the biggest stars in the world right now, Justin Bieber,  got his start on YouTube.
zh: 正如我上述， 现在最红的艺人贾斯汀·比伯， 也是从YouTube上窜红。

en: And we all now feel some ownership  in our own pop culture.
zh: 在自创流行文化中 我们都有自主权。

en: And these are not characteristics of old media,  and they're barely true of the media of today,  but they will define the entertainment of the future.
zh: 然而这一切并不是旧媒体的特征， 也不能完全代表今天的媒体， 不过它们一定会成为未来媒体的娱乐形态。

en: Thank you.
zh: 谢谢。

en: How can I speak in 10 minutes  about the bonds of women over three generations,  about how the astonishing strength of those bonds  took hold in the life  of a four-year-old girl  huddled with her young sister,  her mother and her grandmother  for five days and nights  in a small boat in the China Sea  more than 30 years ago,  bonds that took hold in the life of that small girl
zh: 10分钟何尝够我来讲述， 关于三代妇女间的纽带， 关于这条纽带的惊人的力量 把 4岁小姑娘和 她的妹妹 母亲、祖母绑在一起， 5天5夜 挤在一条小船飘在中国海 已经过去了30多年， 一直留在小女孩的脑海中

en: This is not a finished story.
zh: 一个不断延续的故事

en: It is a jigsaw puzzle still being put together.
zh: 就像一幅正在被拼接的拼图一样

en: Let me tell you about some of the pieces.
zh: 请允许我讲述其中的片段

en: Imagine the first piece:  a man burning his life's work.
zh: 回想起来的第一个画面是 一个男人拼尽全力地工作。

en: He is a poet, a playwright,  a man whose whole life  had been balanced on the single hope  of his country's unity and freedom.
zh: 他是一个诗人兼剧作家 一生 都致力于 国家的统一和自由。

en: Imagine him as the communists enter Saigon,  confronting the fact  that his life had been a complete waste.
zh: 想象着他作为一名共产主义者进入胡志明市 面对着 完全被抛弃的一生

en: Words, for so long his friends, now mocked him.
zh: 面对朋友们的嘲笑

en: But our lives are much more than our memories.
zh: 但是我们的生活比记忆更加丰富。

en: My grandmother never let me forget his life.
zh: 祖父让我永记他的一生。

en: My mother, Mai, was 18  when her father died --  already in an arranged marriage,  already with two small girls.
zh: 我母亲，Mai，18岁 丧父 经历了一系列婚姻， 有了两个小女儿。

en: For her, life had distilled itself into one task:  the escape of her family  and a new life in Australia.
zh: 对于她，生活唯一目的就是 逃离家庭 在澳大利亚开始新生活。

en: It was inconceivable to her  that she would not succeed.
zh: 这对她来说， 简直就是天方夜谭。

en: So after a four-year saga that defies fiction,  a boat slipped out to sea  disguised as a fishing vessel.
zh: 因此，4年的蔑视小说的长篇故事 一条小船滑向大海， 远离渔船。

en: If we were captured, first my sister and I,  then she and my grandmother would drink.
zh: 如果我们被抓获，我妹妹、我、 母亲和祖母依次服毒自尽。

en: I don't remember the pirates who came many times,  but were bluffed by the bravado  of the men on our boat,  or the engine dying  and failing to start for six hours.
zh: 我不记得海盗来了几次， 却被船上男人们的虚张声势 吓跑了， 引擎熄火， 6个小时无法启动。

en: But I do remember the lights on the oil rig  off the Malaysian coast  and the young man who collapsed and died,  the journey's end too much for him,  and the first apple I tasted,  given to me by the men on the rig.
zh: 但是我记得边石油钻井反射的光； 来自马来西亚海岸 年轻小伙虚脱而死， 旅途早早结束； 我尝到的第一个苹果， 来自同船的一个男人。

en: We settled in Footscray,  a working-class suburb  whose demographic is layers of immigrants.
zh: 定居于Footscray， 一个的工薪阶层市郊, 以移民为主.

en: And the snippets of halting English  were exchanged between people  who had one thing in common,  they were starting again.
zh: 说着同样磕磕绊绊的英语， 人们相互交流着。 有一件事情是相同的， 又重新开始了。

en: My mother worked on farms,  then on a car assembly line,  working six days, double shifts.
zh: 母亲一开始在农村干活， 后来去了汽车组装线， 一周工作6天，双班倒。

en: Somehow she found time to study English  and gain IT qualifications.
zh: 有时她挤时间学习英语， 获得了IT资格证。

en: All the dollars were allocated  and extra tuition in English and mathematics  was budgeted for  regardless of what missed out,  which was usually new clothes;  they were always secondhand.
zh: 节约每一分钱。 剩余的钱都用来缴英语和数学的学费， 不管再难， 即使没有 新衣服穿， 穿二手的。

en: Two pairs of stockings for school,  each to hide the holes in the other.
zh: 上学时穿两双袜子， 一双遮挡另一双上的洞。

en: And there were rare but searing chants  of "slit-eye"  and the occasional graffiti:  "Asian, go home."
zh: 虽然很少，但是搜寻圣歌的 边边角角， 偶尔的涂鸦说 “亚洲人，回家去吧！”

en: Go home to where?
zh: 回家回到哪儿？

en: Something stiffened inside me.
zh: 一些事情刺痛了我的内心。

en: There was a gathering of resolve  and a quiet voice saying, "I will bypass you."
zh: 一股力量在凝聚， 安静的声音在说：“我要超越你。”

en: My mother was exhausted each night,  but we told one another about our day  and listened to the movements  of my grandmother around the house.
zh: 每晚母亲都拖着疲惫的身体回家， 但是我们互相交流一天的事情， 听着旁白房间 祖母的动静。

en: And my job was to stay awake until her nightmares came  so I could wake her.
zh: 我的工作就是保持清醒，在她做恶梦的时候 叫醒她。

en: And the women came with their stories  about men who could not make the transition,  angry and inflexible,  and troubled children caught between two worlds.
zh: 关于男人的故事， 没有过渡， 生气，呆板， 问题小孩，就像两个世界。

en: In one, I was the classic Asian student,  relentless in the demands that I made on myself.
zh: 一方面，我是典型的亚洲学生， 自己特别狠；

en: In the other, I was enmeshed in lives that were precarious,  tragically scarred by violence,  drug abuse and isolation.
zh: 另一方面，我纠缠于现实的危险， 暴力冲突的可悲， 毒品泛滥和种族隔离。

en: And I was catapulted  from one piece of the jigsaw to another,  and their edges didn't fit.
zh: 我直接 从一个片段跳到了另一个， 没有漂亮的连接。

en: Tan Le, anonymous Footscray resident,  was now Tan Le, refugee and social activist,  invited to speak in venues she had never heard of  and into homes whose existence  she could never have imagined.
zh: Tan Le一名Footscray普通居民， 现在是难民，社会积极分子， 被邀请演讲， 去一个从未听说过的 去一个无法想象是否存在的地方。

en: I didn't know how to use the cutlery.
zh: 不知道如何用刀具，

en: I didn't know how to talk about wine.
zh: 不会谈论葡萄酒，

en: I didn't know how to talk about anything.
zh: 不会讲话。

en: I wanted to retreat to the routines and comfort  of life in an unsung suburb --  a grandmother, a mother and two daughters  ending each day as they had for almost 20 years,  telling one another the story of their day  and falling asleep,  the three of us still in the same bed.
zh: 我想要退回到原来， 无名市郊的舒适生活-- 祖母、目前和两个女儿 过着20多年的平淡生活， 相互谈论着过去的日子， 渐渐入睡， 我们三个还在一个床上。

en: I told my mother I couldn't do it.
zh: 我告诉我母亲，我做不到。

en: "Just do it," she said,  "and don't be what you're not."
zh: “放手去做”，她说 “做真正的自己”

en: And the more candidly I spoke,  the more I was asked to speak.
zh: 我说的越坦率， 越是有人邀请我演讲。

en: I met people from all walks of life,  so many of them doing the thing they loved,  living on the frontiers of possibility.
zh: 遇见周围的人们， 做着自己喜欢的事情， 生活的

en: And I realized at the same time  that it is okay to be an outsider,  a recent arrival,  new on the scene --  and not just okay,  but something to be thankful for,  perhaps a gift from the boat.
zh: 同一时间，我意识到 作为局外人也可以， 最近的事情， 屏幕上的新闻 不仅仅是可以， 一些事情归功于 来自小船的经历。

en: I have stepped outside my comfort zone enough now  to know that, yes, the world does fall apart,  but not in the way that you fear.
zh: 我现在得站在舒适区足够远 是的，世界开始破碎， 不是按照你担心的那样。

en: Possibilities that would not have been allowed  were outrageously encouraged.
zh: 不允许贸然或者 鼓励放大可能性。

en: So I followed my hunches.
zh: 跟随我的预感。

en: I gathered around me a small team of people  for whom the label "It can't be done"  was an irresistible challenge.
zh: 我聚集了一个小组 “不能完成”的标签 是我们唯一的挑战。
