en: My family was not poor,  and myself, I had never experienced hunger.
zh: 我的家庭并不贫穷。 而且对我自己来说，我从来没有体验过饥饿的感觉。

en: But one day, in 1995, my mom brought home a letter  from a coworker's sister.
zh: 但是1995年的一天，我妈妈带了一封信回家 是从她同事的姐妹那里寄来的。

en: It read, "When you read this,  our five family members will not exist in this world,  because we haven't eaten for the past three weeks.
zh: 上面写道，”当你读到这封信时,我家的所有五个人 都将离开人世。 因为我们已经连续两周没有吃东西了。

en: We are lying on the floor together,  and our bodies are so weak, we are waiting to die."
zh: 我们现在一起躺在地板上， 我们的身体都太虚弱，准备等死。“

en: This was the first time I heard that people in my country were suffering.
zh: 那是我第一次听到 活在我的国家的人们所在承受的一切。

en: Soon after, when I was walking past a train station,  I saw something terrible that to this day I can't erase from my memory.
zh: 在这之后不久，当我走过一个火车站时， 我看到一件非常痛心的事情 让我难以忘怀。

en: A lifeless woman was lying on the ground,  while an emaciated child in her arms  just stared helplessly at his mother's face.
zh: 一个奄奄一息的女人正躺在地上， 怀里抱着一个虚弱的孩子， 那个孩子只能绝望地望着他母亲的脸。

en: But nobody helped them,  because they were so focused on taking care of themselves and their families.
zh: 但是没有人帮助他们， 因为大家连自己和自己的家人都无法顾全。

en: This is a satellite picture showing North Korea at night,  compared to neighbors.
zh: 这是一张卫星图，拍摄了夜晚的朝鲜 和周边国家的比较。

en: This is the Amnok River,  which serves as a part of the border between North Korea and China.
zh: 这是鸭绿江， 作为着中国和朝鲜 边界的一部分。

en: I can't reveal many details about how I left North Korea,  but I only can say that during the ugly years of the famine,  I was sent to China to live with distant relatives.
zh: 我不能披露太多我离开朝鲜时的细节， 但是我只能说那是在饥荒中最艰难的几年， 我被送到中国和远亲一起住。 当时我以为，

en: But I only thought that I would be separated from my family for a short time.
zh: 我只是和我的家人分开很短一段时间。

en: In China, it was hard living as a young girl without my family.
zh: 在中国，我作为一个没家的小女孩过得很辛苦。

en: But I soon learned it's not only extremely difficult,  it's also very dangerous,  since North Korean refugees are considered in China as illegal migrants.
zh: 但是我很快意识到那生活不但充满了艰辛， 甚至无比危险。 因为朝鲜难民在中国 被视为非法移民，

en: So I was living in constant fear that my identity could be revealed,  and I would be repatriated to a horrible fate,  back in North Korea.
zh: 所以我总是生活在恐惧中， 我害怕我的身份会被人发现。 我会被遣送回朝鲜， 去接受悲惨的命运。

en: Someone had accused me of being North Korean,  so they tested my Chinese language abilities,  and asked me tons of questions.
zh: 有人指控我是朝鲜人， 所以警察测试了我的汉语能力， 并且问了我很多问题。

en: I thought my heart was going to explode.
zh: 感觉我的心都快因恐惧而爆炸了。

en: If anything seemed unnatural, I could be imprisoned and repatriated.
zh: 如果有任何异样，我就会入狱 并被遣送回去，

en: But I managed to control all the emotions inside me,  and answer the questions.
zh: 尽管如此，我还是努力隐藏了自己的恐惧和担忧， 并回答了他们的问题。

en: After they finished questioning me,  one official said to another,  "This was a false report. She's not North Korean."
zh: 这之后， 一个警察对另一个人说，“ 报告是错误的， 她不是朝鲜人。”

en: And they let me go. It was a miracle.
zh: 然后他们放我走了。真是个奇迹。

en: Even though I was really fortunate to get out,  many other North Koreans have not been so lucky.
zh: 尽管我足够幸运能离开朝鲜， 我的好多同胞却没有这样的好运气。

en: It's tragic that North Koreans have to hide their identities  and struggle so hard just to survive.
zh: 这是个很悲惨的事实，那就是朝鲜人必须要隐姓埋名， 如此努力仅仅为了能生存下去。

en: Even after learning a new language and getting a job,  their whole world can be turned upside down in an instant.
zh: 即使他们学会了中文，找到了工作， 他们的整个世界也会在顷刻间颠覆。

en: That's why, after 10 years of hiding my identity,  I decided to risk going to South Korea.
zh: 这就是为什么，在隐姓埋名10年后， 我决定冒险去韩国。

en: English was so important in South Korea,  so I had to start learning my third language.
zh: 英语在韩国太重要了， 所以我必须要开始学习第三门语言——英语。

en: Also, I realized there was a wide gap between North and South.
zh: 此外，我意识到， 韩国与朝鲜之间有巨大的差异。

en: We are all Korean, but inside,  we have become very different, due to 67 years of division.
zh: 尽管我们都是朝鲜族人， 但是我们的内在已经变得非常不同了， 由于67年的分裂。

en: I even went through an identity crisis.
zh: 我甚至经历了自我身份的质疑。

en: Where am I from? Who am I?
zh: 我从哪里来？我是谁？

en: Even though adjusting to life in South Korea was not easy,  I made a plan -- I started studying for the university entrance exam.
zh: 尽管适应韩国的生活并不是易事， 但是我还是决定 准备大学入学考试。

en: Just as I was starting to get used to my new life,  I received a shocking phone call.
zh: 就在我刚开始习惯新生活不久， 我接到了一个令人震惊的电话。

en: The North Korean authorities intercepted some money  that I sent to my family,  and, as a punishment, my family was going to be forcibly removed  to a desolate location in the countryside.
zh: 朝鲜政府拦截了 我寄回家的部分钱款， 作为惩罚，我的家人要被 强制搬走， 搬到农村的一个偏僻的地方去。

en: It's almost impossible to cross the border  between North Korea and South Korea.
zh: 要想穿越朝鲜与韩国 的边境几乎是不可能的，

en: He took everyone's I.D. cards,  and he started asking them questions.
zh: 他查看每个人的身份证， 并开始问问题。

en: As the Chinese officer approached my family,  I impulsively stood up, and I told him  that these are deaf and dumb people that I was chaperoning.
zh: 所以当那个中国警官快检查到我家人时， 我本能地站起来告诉他 这几位是聋哑人， 我是他们的监护人。

en: We made it all the way to the border of Laos.
zh: 就这样我们一路来到了老挝，

en: But I had to spend almost all my money  to bribe the border guards in Laos.
zh: 但是我却要几乎花光全部积蓄来 贿赂老挝的边境警察。

en: I did everything to get my family to freedom,  and we came so close,  but my family was thrown in jail,  just a short distance from the South Korean embassy.
zh: 我为了让我的家人获得自由，倾尽所能 然而就在快要成功的时候， 家人却又要经历牢狱之灾， 并且这个监狱离朝鲜大使馆并不远。

en: I was so surprised that a total stranger cared enough to ask.
zh: 一个完全的陌生人这样关切地询问。

en: In my broken English, and with a dictionary,  I explained the situation, and without hesitating,  the man went to the ATM,  and he paid the rest of the money for my family,  and two other North Koreans to get out of jail.
zh: 我用蹩脚的英文再借助字典， 毫不犹豫地向那个人解释了情况。 那个人走去ATM机， 为我的家人以及另两个朝鲜人 支付了出狱的剩余的所有费用。

en: I thanked him with all my heart, and I asked him,  "Why are you helping me?"
zh: 我真心地感谢他，并问道， “你为什么要帮助我？”

en: The kind stranger symbolized new hope for me and the North Korean people,  when we needed it most.
zh: 那个善良的陌生人象征着我以及 朝鲜人最需要的希望。

en: Eventually, after our long journey,  my family and I were reunited in South Korea.
zh: 最终，在经历了漫长的旅行后， 我和家人终于在韩国重聚。

en: Many North Koreans are separated from their families,  and when they arrive in a new country,  they start with little or no money.
zh: 很多朝鲜人和他们的家人分离， 并且当他们来到新的国家时， 他们通常都只有很少的钱，或者身无分文。

en: Because many of us stay in contact with family members still inside,  and we send information and money  that is helping to change North Korea from inside.
zh: 因为我们很多人都和 生活在朝鲜的家人保持联系。 我们寄送回去的信息和钱 都在内在地改变朝鲜。

en: I've been so lucky, received so much help and inspiration in my life,  so I want to help give aspiring North Koreans  a chance to prosper with international support.
zh: 我是如此幸运， 在人生中得到了这么多帮助和启示， 所以我想帮助那些心怀梦想的朝鲜人 在国际的援助下， 一个实现梦想的机会。

en: Thank you.
zh: 谢谢

en: This is South Central:  liquor stores,  fast food,  vacant lots.
zh: 这就是洛杉矶南区： 贩酒店， 快餐店， 闲置的土地。

en: So the city planners, they get together and they figure  they're going to change the name South Central to make it represent something else,  so they change it to South Los Angeles,  like this is going to fix what's really going wrong in the city.
zh: 因此城市的规划者他们坐在一起讨论 想把洛杉矶南区这个名字改的代表点别的什么含义， 所以他们把它改成了南洛杉矶， 好像这将要解决这个城市真正的问题似的。

en: This is South Los Angeles.   Liquor stores,  fast food,  vacant lots.
zh: 这是南洛杉矶 贩酒店， 快餐店， 闲置的土地。

en: And I figured, this has to stop.
zh: 我想不能再这样下去了。

en: Plus I got tired of driving 45 minutes round trip  to get an apple that wasn't impregnated with pesticides.
zh: 再加上我着实厌倦了开45分钟的来回 去买个没打过杀虫剂的苹果。

en: So what I did, I planted a food forest in front of my house.
zh: 因此我做的，就是在我的房子前种上食物森林。

en: It was on a strip of land that we call a parkway.
zh: 它位于我们称为公园路的绿化带上。

en: It's 150 feet by 10 feet.
zh: 150英尺乘以10英尺大小。

en: Thing is, it's owned by the city.
zh: 绿化带归政府所有。

en: But you have to maintain it.
zh: 但是总需要有人维护它。

en: So I'm like, "Cool. I can do whatever the hell I want,  since it's my responsibility and I gotta maintain it."
zh: 因此我觉得，“太好了！这是我的责任，我必须维护它， 所以我想做什么就可以做什么了！”

en: And this is how I decided to maintain it.
zh: 这是我为何要维护它的原因。

en: So me and my group, L.A. Green Grounds, we got together  and we started planting my food forest, fruit trees,  you know, the whole nine, vegetables.
zh: 因此我和我的团队，“洛杉矶绿地”，我们聚在一起 开始种植自己的食物森林，果树， 还有整整九种蔬菜。

en: What we do, we're a pay-it-forward kind of group,  where it's composed of gardeners from all walks of life,  from all over the city, and it's completely volunteer,  and everything we do is free.
zh: 我们是一个自由的组织， 由来自不同行业不同城市的园丁组成。 大家全都是志愿者， 我们所做的一切都是义务的。

en: And the garden, it was beautiful.
zh: 花园非常的美丽，

en: And then somebody complained.
zh: 但是很快就有人抱怨。

en: The city came down on me,  and basically gave me a citation saying that I had to remove my garden,  which this citation was turning into a warrant.
zh: 政府指责我， 给了我张告票通知我必须移除我的花园， 之后告票变成了警告函。

en: And I'm like, "Come on, really?
zh: 我心想“搞什么，来真的？

en: A warrant for planting food on a piece of land  that you could care less about?"   And I was like, "Cool. Bring it."
zh: 禁止在一小块土地上种食物 而之前这块土地却没人关心？ 然后我想，”酷，就这样吧。“

en: So L.A. Times got ahold of it. Steve Lopez did a story on it and talked to the councilman,  and one of the Green Grounds members,  they put up a petition on Change.org,  and with 900 signatures, we were a success.
zh: 所以洛杉矶时报报道了，斯蒂夫·洛佩兹写了个关于它的故事 并和议员以及一个绿地组织的成员 进行了交谈， 他们将请愿书上传到了Change.org， 并且收集到了900个签名，我们成功 了！

en: My councilman even called in and said how they endorse  and love what we're doing.
zh: 议员甚至前来拜访，表达了他有多么赞赏 和热爱我们所做的。

en: L.A. leads the United States in vacant lots that the city actually owns.
zh: 洛杉矶所拥有的空地的数量在美国名列前茅。

en: That's enough space to plant 725 million tomato plants.
zh: 有足够的空间去种植七亿两千五百万的番茄。

en: Growing one plant will give you 1,000, 10,000 seeds.
zh: 种一棵树能够收到一千，甚至一万颗种子。

en: I grew up there. I raised my sons there.
zh: 我在那里成长，我在那里养育我的儿子。

en: Just like a graffiti artist, where they beautify walls,  me, I beautify lawns, parkways.
zh: 就好像涂鸦艺术家一样，他们美化墙壁。 而我，美化草坪，绿化带。

en: I use the garden, the soil, like it's a piece of cloth,  and the plants and the trees,  that's my embellishment for that cloth.
zh: 我把花园和土地视为画布， 而植物和树木 就是我在画布上的装饰。

en: You'd be surprised what the soil could do  if you let it be your canvas.
zh: 你可能会震惊土地所能做的 如果你把它当成你的画布。

en: You'd be surprised how kids are affected by this.
zh: 你会为孩子们如何被影响而震惊。

en: Gardening is the most therapeutic  and defiant act you can do,  especially in the inner city.
zh: 园艺活动是最有益于身体健康以及 挑战性十足的活动， 尤其是这项活动在市中心进行。

en: I remember this time,  there was this mother and a daughter came,  it was, like, 10:30 at night, and they were in my yard,  and I came out and they looked so ashamed.
zh: 我记得有次， 一个妈妈和女儿在 差不多晚上10点半的时候偷偷摸摸的出现在我的菜园， 当我出来看到她们，她们显得非常难为情。

en: So I'm like, man, it made me feel bad that they were there,  and I told them, you know, you don't have to do this like this.
zh: 她们的出现使我感觉非常糟糕， 我告诉他们，你们不用像这样来拿食物。

en: This is on the street for a reason.
zh: 这是菜园在街上的原因。

en: It made me feel ashamed to see people  that were this close to me that were hungry,  and this only reinforced why I do this,  and people asked me, "Fin, aren't you afraid  people are going to steal your food?"
zh: 当我看到我身边的人们 饿着肚子时，这让我觉得非常羞愧。 这加强了我做（食物森林）的决心。 人们问我，“Fin，你难道不怕 人们来偷你食物吗？”

en: And I'm like, "Hell no, I ain't afraid they're gonna steal it.
zh: 我回答说，“当然不啦，我当然不怕人们会偷它，

en: That's the whole idea.
zh: 这正是我想要的。

en: I want them to take it, but at the same time,  I want them to take back their health."
zh: 我想要人们拿走它，但是同时， 我也希望人们能够重归健康的身体。”

en: There's another time when I put  a garden in this homeless shelter in downtown Los Angeles.
zh: 还有一次当我 在洛杉矶市中心的一个流浪汉之家安置了一个花园。

en: These are the guys, they helped me unload the truck.
zh: 这些小伙子帮助我卸了货。

en: It was cool, and they just shared the stories  about how this affected them and how  they used to plant with their mother and their grandmother,  and it was just cool to see how this changed them,  if it was only for that one moment.
zh: 这很酷，他们分享了关于花园如何对他们 产生影响以及他们如何与自己的 母亲以及祖母一起种植的故事， 看到花园可以改变他们真是一件非常酷的事情， 仅仅为了这一刻，

en: We've had, like, 50 people come to our dig-ins  and participate, and it's all volunteers.
zh: 我们已经有大约50人参与到我们的团队中来， 他们全都是志愿者。

en: If they grow tomatoes, they eat tomatoes.   But when none of this is presented to them,  if they're not shown how food affects the mind and the body,  they blindly eat whatever the hell you put in front of them.
zh: 如果他们种植番茄，他们就会吃番茄。 但是当这些都没有呈现在孩子们眼前， 如果他们并没有体会到食物是如何影响人的想法和身体的， 他们只是盲目的吃着任何摆在他们面前的食物。

en: I see young people  and they want to work,  but they're in this thing where they're caught up --  I see kids of color and they're just on this track  that's designed for them,  that leads them to nowhere.
zh: 我看到年轻人们 他们想要工作， 但是他们都很乐意在这件事上花时间， 我看到不同肤色的孩子们，他们一直循规蹈矩 走着别人为他们设计的路， 而这条路却不知所终。

en: We might produce the next George Washington Carver.
zh: 培养出下一个乔治华盛顿呢。

en: but if we don't change the composition of the soil,  we will never do this.
zh: 但是如果我们不改变土壤的成分， 我们永远不会这样做。

en: Now this is one of my plans. This is what I want to do.
zh: 这使我目前计划中的一个。这是我想要做的。

en: I want to take shipping containers  and turn them into healthy cafes.
zh: 我想要把集装箱 改造为健康的咖啡屋。

en: Now don't get me wrong.
zh: 别误会。

en: What I'm talking about is putting people to work,  and getting kids off the street, and letting them know  the joy, the pride and the honor in growing your own food,  opening farmer's markets.
zh: 我所讲的就是让人们得到工作， 让孩子们远离街道，让他们了解 自己种植食物的喜悦，荣誉和荣耀， 开放农民市场。

en: So what I want to do here,  we gotta make this sexy.
zh: 因此我想要做的 是想把这个计划弄的更加吸引人。

en: So I want us all to become ecolutionary renegades,  gangstas, gangsta gardeners.
zh: 我想要我们成为环境革命的叛徒， 流氓，流氓园丁。

en: We gotta flip the script on what a gangsta is.
zh: 我们要改写流氓的定义

en: Get gangsta with your shovel, okay?
zh: 当个拿铲子的流氓，怎么样？

en: And let that be your weapon of choice.
zh: 让铲子成为你选择的武器吧。

en: So basically, if you want to meet with me,  you know, if you want to meet,  don't call me if you want to sit around in cushy chairs  and have meetings where you talk about doing some shit --  where you talk about doing some shit.
zh: （鼓掌） 基本上，如果你们想见我， 如果想要碰面， 如果想坐在舒适的椅子上 讲一些有的没的 就别给我打电话。

en: If you want to meet with me, come to the garden  with your shovel so we can plant some shit.
zh: 如果想见我，就拿着铁铲来花园吧 这样我们就可以种点东西啦。

en: Peace. Thank you.
zh: 讲完了，谢谢！

en: Thank you.
zh: 谢谢。

en: You probably all agree with me  that this is a very nice road.
zh: (锤声）  （微波炉声） 你们也许会同意 这条路很不错。

en: Then you can have a lot of splash water in the asphalt.
zh: 在沥青路上会溅起很多水。

en: And especially if you then ride with your bicycle,  and pass these cars, then that's not very nice.
zh: 尤其是如果你正骑着自行车， 与那些车擦肩而过，就不太好啦。

en: It's a noisy material,  and if we produce roads like in the Netherlands,  very close to cities, then we would like a silent road.
zh: 这种材料有点吵， 如果我们要修的路紧邻城市， 像荷兰的道路那样，我们就会希望噪音小一些。

en: The solution for that is to make roads  out of porous asphalt.
zh: 解决的办法就是 使用多孔沥青来修路。

en: Porous asphalt, a material that we use now  in most of the highways in the Netherlands,  it has pores and water can just rain through it,  so all the rainwater will flow away to the sides,  and you have a road that's easy to drive on,  so no splash water anymore.
zh: 多孔沥青这种材料 用在荷兰的多数高速公路上， 它有些小毛孔让水渗过去， 雨水会流向旁边， 路上驾车就容易了， 也没有溅起的水花。

en: Because it's very hollow, all the noise will disappear,  so it's a very silent road.
zh: 因为它有很多空洞，相互抵消了噪音， 所以路就很安静。

en: What is raveling? You see that in this road  that the stones at the surface come off.
zh: 什么叫松脱？看看这条路 路面上的石头脱落。

en: First you get one stone, then several more,  and more and more and more and more,  and then they -- well, I will not do that.   But they can damage your windshield,  so you're not happy with that.
zh: 开始一块，接着几块， 越来越多， 后来就——我就不演示了。 但它们会损坏你的挡风玻璃， 你肯定不高兴。

en: Sometimes you can create potholes with that.
zh: 有时候路面会出现坑槽

en: Potholes, of course, that can become a problem,  but we have a solution.
zh: 坑坑洼洼当然会变成问题， 但我们有解决的办法。

en: Here you see actually how the damage appears in this material.
zh: 这里你看到的是这种材料上出现的损害。

en: It's a porous asphalt, like I said, so you have only  a small amount of binder between the stones.
zh: 这是沥青，就像我说的， 石头中间有少量的粘合剂。

en: Due to weathering, due to U.V. light, due to oxidation,  this binder, this bitumen,  the glue between the aggregates is going to shrink,  and if it shrinks, it gets micro-cracks,  and it delaminates from the aggregates.
zh: 由于风化、紫外线、氧化等原因 这种粘合剂，这种沥青， 集料之间的黏胶会收缩， 如果它收缩，就会有小裂纹， 从集块开始会出现分层。

en: Then if you drive over the road, you take out the aggregates --  what we just saw here.
zh: 如果你在这种路上行驶，你会带出这些集料-- 就是我们看到的。

en: To solve this problem, we thought of self-healing materials.
zh: 为了解决这个问题，我们考虑到了自我修复材料。

en: So what we can do is use steel wool just to clean pans,  and the steel wool we can cut in very small pieces,  and these very small pieces we can mix to the bitumen.
zh: 我们用的就是清洁厨具用的钢丝绒， 钢丝绒可以裁成很小块， 我们把这些小块混进沥青。

en: So then you have asphalt  with very small pieces of steel wool in it.
zh: 所以现在的沥青 有一些小钢丝绒在里面。

en: Induction can heat, especially steel; it's very good at that.
zh: 感应电机可以加热东西，尤其擅长加热钢铁

en: Then what you do is you heat up the steel,  you melt the bitumen,  and the bitumen will flow into these micro-cracks,  and the stones are again fixed to the surface.
zh: 所以我们要做的就是把钢铁加热， 把沥青溶化， 沥青就会流进那些小裂缝里， 脱落的小石子就又被粘上了。

en: So I put the specimen in, which I'm now going to take out  to see what happened.
zh: 我把样品放进去了，现在把它拿出来 看看发生了什么事。

en: So this is the specimen coming out now.
zh: 这是样品现在的样子。

en: So I said we have such an industrial machine in the lab  to heat up the specimens.
zh: 我们实验室里有工业用的机器 来加热样品。

en: We tested a lot of specimens there,  and then the government, they actually saw our results,  and they thought, "Well, that's very interesting. We have to try that."
zh: 我们测试过很多样品， 政府也看过我们的结果， 他们决定，“这很有趣，我们应该试一下。”

en: So that's what we did here. You see where we were making the test road,  and then of course this road will last several years  without any damage. That's what we know from practice.
zh: 这就是我们做的。你看到的就是做的实验路段， 当然这段路近几年不会坏。 我们在实践中确认了这点。

en: So we took a lot of samples from this road  and we tested them in the lab.
zh: 我们在这段路上取了很多样品 在实验室里进行各种测试。

en: So we did aging on the samples,  did a lot of loading on it, healed them with our induction machine,  and healed them and tested them again.
zh: 我们做了老化实验， 加了很多负载，用我们的感应电机给它们加热， 重复加热和测试。

en: Several times we can repeat that.
zh: 我们可以多次重复。

en: So actually, the conclusion from this research is that  if we go on the road every four years  with our healing machine -- this is the big version  we have made to go on the real road --  if we go on the road every four years  we can double the surface life of this road,  which of course saves a lot of money.
zh: 事实上，这项实验得到的结论是 如果我们每四年在这段路上 用我们的加热机器——超大号微波炉 我们要把这个机器搬到公路上用—— 我们每四年上这段路 路面的寿命会加倍， 当然会省很多钱。

en: Well, to conclude, I can say  that we made a material  using steel fibers, the addition of steel fibers,  using induction energy to really  increase the surface life of the road,  double the surface life you can even do,  so it will really save a lot of money with very simple tricks.
zh: 所以，结论是 我们制造了一种材料 使用钢纤维，加了钢纤维 使用感应能量 有效的增加了路面的寿命， 能使路面的寿命加倍， 用这种简单的技巧就会省很多钱。

en: And now you're of course curious if it also worked.
zh: 你会好奇是否会有效。

en: So we still have the specimen here. It's quite warm.
zh: 我们看这个样品。现在还有点烫。

en: But I will do a trial.
zh: 但是要尝试一下。

en: Let's see. Yeah, it worked.
zh: 看，真的，修好了。

en: Thank you.
zh: 谢谢！

en: When I was 11,  I remember waking up one morning to the sound of joy in my house.
zh: 我11岁那年， 记得有一天早晨醒来，听见家里有愉悦的声音。

en: There was a big smile on his face which was unusual then,  because the news mostly depressed him.
zh: 他面带笑容，这很少见， 因为大部分的新闻都只会使他沮丧。

en: "The Taliban are gone!" my father shouted.
zh: “塔利班走了！” 父亲大声叫着。

en: I didn't know what it meant,  but I could see that my father was very, very happy.
zh: 我不知道那意味着什么， 但是我能看出父亲非常非常高兴。

en: You see, I was six when the Taliban took over Afghanistan  and made it illegal for girls to go to school.
zh: 我6岁那年，塔利班占领阿富汗 并规定女孩上学是违法的。

en: It was the only way we both could be educated.
zh: 这是我们俩人唯一的受教育方式。

en: Each day, we took a different route  so that no one would suspect where we were going.
zh: 我们每天要走不同的路线 这样才没有人会怀疑我们要去哪里。

en: We would cover our books in grocery bags  so it would seem we were just out shopping.
zh: 我们把书放在食品杂货袋中 这样别人就会以为我们只是要去购物

en: It was cozy in winter but extremely hot in summer.
zh: 冬天很舒服，但夏天却极热。

en: We all knew we were risking our lives --  the teacher, the students and our parents.
zh: 我们都知道自己正冒着生命的危险- 老师，学生以及家长都很明白

en: We always wondered what they knew about us.
zh: 我们总是担心会被塔利班发现。

en: A total maverick from a remote province of Afghanistan,  he insisted that his daughter, my mom,  go to school, and for that he was disowned by his father.
zh: 他出身阿富汗边远地区，有着与他人不同的见解 他坚持让他的女儿，我的母亲， 去上学，并因此被迫与他的父亲断绝父子关系。

en: But my educated mother became a teacher.
zh: 但是我那受过教育的母亲成为了一名教师。

en: There she is.
zh: 那就是她。

en: She retired two years ago, only to turn our house  into a school for girls and women in our neighborhood.
zh: 她两年前退休了，结果却把我家 变成了一所学校，教育社区中的女孩和妇女

en: There was no question that his children  would receive an education, including his daughters,  despite the Taliban, despite the risks.
zh: 因此毫无疑问，他的孩子 应当受到教育，包括他的女儿， 尽管有塔利班，尽管有风险。

en: To him, there was greater risk in not educating his children.
zh: 对他来说，孩子不接受教育才是更大的风险。

en: During Taliban years, I remember  there were times I would get so frustrated by our life  and always being scared and not seeing a future.
zh: 在塔利班控制阿富汗的那些年，我记得 有时我会对自己的生活感到沮丧 总是会害怕，看不见未来。

en: I would want to quit,  but my father,  he would say,  "Listen, my daughter,  you can lose everything you own in your life.
zh: 我想过要放弃， 但我的父亲 这时就会说 “听着，我的女儿， 你可能失去你生命中的任何东西。

en: Your money can be stolen. You can be forced to leave your home during a war.
zh: 你的钱可能被偷，你可能因战争而背井离乡。

en: But the one thing that will always remain with you  is what is here,  and if we have to sell our blood to pay your school fees,  we will.
zh: 而你唯一能够守护住的东西 就是这里， 如果我们不得不靠卖血来支付你的学费， 我们会毫不犹豫。

en: I was raised in a country that has been destroyed  by decades of war.
zh: 我所成长的国家被几十年的 战争所摧毁。

en: Fewer than six percent of women my age have made it beyond high school,  and had my family not been so committed to my education,  I would be one of them.
zh: 我这个年龄的女性中，高中毕业的人数不到6%， 如果不是我家人的坚持， 我也会像绝大多数人一样。

en: When I returned to Afghanistan, my grandfather,  the one exiled from his home for daring to educate his daughters,  was among the first to congratulate me.
zh: 当我回到阿富汗时，我的祖父， 那位因让女儿接受教育而被逐出家门的老人， 最先向我表示了祝贺。

en: That's why I am a global ambassador for 10x10,  a global campaign to educate women.
zh: 这就是我成为 "10x10" 的全球大使的原因， 这是一个致力于女性教育的全球组织。

en: That's why I cofounded SOLA,  the first and perhaps only boarding school  for girls in Afghanistan,  a country where it's still risky for girls to go to school.
zh: 那也是我参与创立 SOLA 的原因， 这是第一所，可能也是阿富汗唯一一所 寄宿女校， 因为在阿富汗，让女孩接受教育依然十分危险。

en: The exciting thing is that I see students at my school  with ambition grabbing at opportunity.
zh: 让我兴奋的是，我看见我学校中的学生 能够把握机遇，志向远大。

en: Like Ahmed. That's not his real name,  and I cannot show you his face,  but Ahmed is the father of one of my students.
zh: 比如艾哈迈德，这不是真名， 我也不能让你们看见他的长相， 他是我一个学生的父亲。

en: Less than a month ago, he and his daughter  were on their way from SOLA to their village,  and they literally missed being killed  by a roadside bomb by minutes.
zh: 不到一个月前，他和他女儿 在从学校回村里的路上 他们差一点就被 路边炸弹炸死。

en: As he arrived home, the phone rang,  a voice warning him  that if he sent his daughter back to school,  they would try again.
zh: 他到家时，电话响了， 一个声音警告他 如果他再将女儿送去学校， 刚才的事情就会再次发生。

en: What I've come to realize about Afghanistan,  and this is something that is often dismissed in the West,  that behind most of us who succeed  is a father who recognizes the value in his daughter  and who sees that her success is his success.
zh: 对于阿富汗，我意识到 ——这是西方国家也不曾意识到的—— 即在我们成功的背后 是一个这样的父亲——他能认识到自己女儿的价值， 也明白女儿的成功，就是他自己的成功。

en: It's not to say that our mothers aren't key in our success.
zh: 这并不是说母亲们对于我们的成功并不重要。

en: In fact, they're often the initial and convincing negotiators  of a bright future for their daughters,  but in the context of a society like in Afghanistan,  we must have the support of men.
zh: 事实上，为了女儿的美好未来，她们通常是 最初和最有说服力的交涉者， 但是在像阿富汗这样的社会中， 我们必须有男性的支持。

en: Under the Taliban, girls who went to school  numbered in the hundreds --  remember, it was illegal.
zh: 在塔利班控制下，去上学的女孩 曾经只有几百人—— 请不要忘了，当时是非法的。

en: I find that Americans see the fragility in changes.
zh: 我发现，美国人能看出我们变化中的脆弱性。

en: But when I am back in Afghanistan,  when I see the students in my school  and their parents who advocate for them,  who encourage them, I see a promising future  and lasting change.
zh: 但是当我回到阿富汗 看见我的学生 以及支持她们 并鼓励她们的父母时，我看到了未来的希望， 也看到这种变化会延续下去。

en: To me, Afghanistan is a country of hope and boundless possibilities,  and every single day  the girls of SOLA remind me of that.
zh: 对我来说，阿富汗充满了希望和无限的可能性， 每一天 在 SOLA 读书的女孩儿都这么提醒着我。

en: Thank you.
zh: 谢谢。

en: And there it was, a great revolution.
zh: 这是一场伟大的革命运动。

en: Eventually, after a period of six months of brutal war  and a toll rate of almost 50,000 dead,  we managed to liberate our country and to topple the tyrant.
zh: 最终，经过六个月惨烈的战争， 以50,000人死亡为代价， 我们推翻了暴政统治，迎来了国家的自由。

en: However, Gaddafi left behind a heavy burden,  a legacy of tyranny, corruption and seeds of diversions.
zh: 但是，卡扎菲给我们留下沉重负担 他留下专政、腐败的陋习，埋下了分裂的种子。

en: Aware of the devastation and the challenges,  I was keen among many other women to rebuild the Libyan civil society,  calling for an inclusive and just transition  to democracy and national reconciliation.
zh: 我深知卡扎菲独裁所造成的破坏，也深知我们面临的挑战， 我同许多热血女性一起尝试重建利比亚的公民社会， 我们呼吁在利比亚体现宽容与公正的精神 以实现民主和民族间的和解。

en: With an amazing group of women,  I co-founded the Libyan Women's Platform for Peace,  a movement of women, leaders, from different walks of life,  to lobby for the sociopolitical empowerment of women  and to lobby for our right  for equal participation in building democracy and peace.
zh: 我和一群了不起的女性一起， 创办了利比亚女性和平平台。 这是一场各行各业女性的运动、领导者的运动。 我们为女性争取参与社会政治生活的权利， 为我们女性争取 平等参与民主与和平建设的权利。

en: I met a very difficult environment in the pre-elections,  an environment which was increasingly polarized,  an environment which was shaped by the selfish politics of dominance and exclusion.
zh: 在大选前，国内的形势非常糟糕， 国内两级分化日益严重， 这是因为我们的政治是自私的，是充满了控制和排斥的。

en: I led an initiative by the Libyan Women's Platform for Peace  to lobby for a more inclusive electoral law,  a law that would give every citizen, no matter what your background,  the right to vote and run,  and most importantly to stipulate on political parties  the alternation of male and female candidates vertically and horizontally in their lists,  creating the zipper list.
zh: 我在利比亚女性和平平台提出了一项倡议， 呼吁利比亚施行更具包容性的选举法, 让利比亚的每一位公民，无论背景如何， 都有选举和参选的权利， 最重要的是，我呼吁在政党中应当规定 无论在地区间还是在不同级别间， 都由男性和女性轮流担当候选人， 形成交叉式的候选人名单。

en: However, bit by bit, the euphoria of the elections,  and of the revolution as a whole,  was fading out --  for every day we were waking up to the news of violence.
zh: 然而，一点一点地， 大选和革命所带来的欢欣喜悦 在我们国家中消失了， 因为每天早上起床，我们都会看到有关暴力行径的新闻。

en: Our society, shaped by a revolutionary mindset,  became more polarized  and has driven away from the ideals and the principles --  freedom, dignity, social justice --  Intolerance, exclusion and revenge  became the icons of the [aftermath] of the revolution.
zh: 我们的社会深受武装革命的心态影响， 越来越分化， 也背弃了我们起初秉持的理想和原则， 也就是—— 自由、尊严和社会公正。 偏狭、排斥和报复 成了革命后我们社会的标志。

en: I'm rather here today to confess  that we as a nation took the wrong choice, made the wrong decision.
zh: 我在这里是要坦白， 我们在推翻卡扎菲政府时所作出的决定是错误的，

en: Did the zipper list and the alternation between female and male candidates  bring peace and national reconciliation?
zh: 我们倡导的交叉式候选人名单 为利比亚带来和平，带来民族间的和解了吗？

en: No, it didn't.
zh: 不，并没有。

en: What is it, then?
zh: 那么，关键的问题到底是什么呢？

en: Why does our society continue to be polarized and dominated  with selfish politics of dominance and exclusion, by both men and women?
zh: 为什么我们的社会还是分化严重？ 为什么我们的政治在男女都参与的情况下，还是充满了控制和排斥呢？

en: Our society needs the qualitative representation of the feminine  more than it needs the numerical, quantitative representation of the feminine.
zh: 我们的社会需要的是女性特质的代表， 这对我们的社会来说比女性在数量上的代表更为重要。

en: These are the ideals that a war-torn Libya  needs desperately in order to achieve peace.
zh: 这才是饱受战乱的利比亚要走向和平 所迫切需要的努力目标。

en: That's the real zipper.
zh: 和不断交替。 这才是真正的交叉。

en: And we need to establish that existentially  before we do so sociopolitically.
zh: 而且我们需要在社会政治生活运作前 先建立起这种男女交叉的存在。

en: According to a Quranic verse  "Salam" -- peace -- "is the word of the all-merciful God, raheem."
zh: 《可兰经》的一段经文里说， “Salam”——也就是和平——“来自我们最仁慈的主Raheem。”

en: In turn, the word "raheem," which is known in all Abrahamic traditions,  has the same root in Arabic as the word "rahem" -- womb --  symbolizing the maternal feminine encompassing all humanity  from which the male and the female,  from which all tribes, all peoples, have emanated from.
zh: 而在所有亚伯拉罕诸教的传统中都闻名的词“raheem” 在阿拉伯语中与“rahem”同根， “rahem”则象征着充满母性的女性包容着所有人类， 男人和女人 以及所有部落、所有民族的人都是从她发源而来的。

en: And so just as the womb entirely envelopes the embryo, which grows within it,  the divine matrix of compassion nourishes the entire existence.
zh: 就像子宫完全包裹着在其内生长的胚胎一样， 满怀同情之心的神圣母体滋养着世间万物。

en: Thus we are told that "My mercy encompasses all things."
zh: 因此，我们所受的教导告诉我们：“我的怜悯之心包容万物。”

en: Thus we are told that "My mercy takes precedence over my anger."
zh: 因此，我们所受的教导告诉我们：“我的怜悯之心战胜我的愤怒。”

en: May we all be granted a grace of mercy.
zh: 愿我们都被赐予怜悯之心。

en: I'm here today to talk about a disturbing question,  which has an equally disturbing answer.
zh: 今天，我想聊一个令人不安的问题， 这个问题的答案同样令人烦扰。

en: My topic is the secrets of domestic violence,  and the question I'm going to tackle  is the one question everyone always asks:  Why does she stay?
zh: 我要说的是家庭暴力的秘密， 而我将要回答的问题 这个问题每个人都曾经问起： “为什么她会留下来？”

en: Why would anyone stay with a man who beats her?
zh: “怎么会有人愿意和一个打她的男人继续住在一起？”

en: I was 22. I had just graduated from Harvard College.
zh: 当时我22岁，刚从哈佛学院毕业。

en: I had my first apartment,  my first little green American Express card,  and I had a very big secret.
zh: 我第一次有了自己的房子， 有了第一张信用卡。 我还有一个非常大的秘密。

en: My secret was that I had this gun  loaded with hollow-point bullets pointed at my head  by the man who I thought was my soulmate,  many, many times.
zh: 这个秘密就是我曾经 被我认为是我灵魂伴侣的男人 用这把装满空心弹头的枪指着我的头 太多、太多次。

en: I'm here to tell you the story of crazy love,  a psychological trap disguised as love,  one that millions of women and even a few men  fall into every year.
zh: 现在我所讲述的这个“疯狂爱情”的故事， 是一个伪装成爱情的心理陷阱， 每年都会有上百万的女性，甚至也包括一些男性 会掉进这个陷阱。

en: I've spent most of my career working for Fortune 500 companies  including Johnson & Johnson, Leo Burnett and The Washington Post.
zh: 我决大多数时间都在为"财富"500强公司工作， 包括强生，李奥贝纳和华盛顿邮报。

en: I've been married for almost 20 years to my second husband  and we have three kids together.
zh: 我嫁给我的第二任丈夫差不多20年了 并育有3个孩子。

en: My dog is a black lab, and I drive a Honda Odyssey minivan.
zh: 我养了一只黑色拉布拉多猎犬，开本田奥赛德面包车。

en: I would have told you myself that I was the last person on Earth  who would stay with a man who beats me,  but in fact I was a very typical victim because of my age.
zh: 我原本以为世界上只有我一个人 会继续留在一个打我的男人身边， 但是事实上在我这个年龄段这种事情非常普遍。

en: I was 22, and in the United States,  women ages 16 to 24 are three times as likely  to be domestic violence victims  as women of other ages,  and over 500 women and girls this age  are killed every year by abusive partners,  boyfriends, and husbands in the United States.
zh: 我当时22岁。而在美国， 16至24岁的女性相比其他年龄段的女性 受到家庭暴力伤害的可能性 要高出两倍以上。 同样在美国，每年有超过500位 妇女或女孩被施虐者杀害， 凶手是她们的男友，或者丈夫。

en: I was also a very typical victim because I knew nothing  about domestic violence, its warning signs or its patterns.
zh: 我是一个非常典型的受害者， 还因为我家庭暴力的预兆和发展模式一无所知。

en: He sat next to me on the New York City subway,  and he started chatting me up.
zh: 我们在纽约的地铁上碰巧坐在一起， 他先跟我聊了起来。

en: One was that he, too, had just graduated from an Ivy League school,  and that he worked at a very impressive Wall Street bank.
zh: 第一件是他也毕业于常春藤联盟学校， 并且在一个非常好的华尔街银行工作。

en: But what made the biggest impression on me that first meeting  was that he was smart and funny  and he looked like a farm boy.
zh: 但是第一次见面给我留下最深印象的是 他的智慧和幽默， 而他的外貌看起来像农场男孩。

en: He had these big cheeks, these big apple cheeks  and this wheat-blond hair,  and he seemed so sweet.
zh: 他的脸颊像大苹果一样红扑扑的 小麦色的金发， 看起来十分讨人喜欢。

en: He did this especially at the beginning  by idolizing me.
zh: 尤其刚开始的时候，他让我觉得 我是他崇拜的偶像。

en: He wanted to know everything about my family  and my childhood and my hopes and dreams.
zh: 他很愿意了解我的家庭、 我的童年、我的愿望和梦想。

en: Conor believed in me, as a writer and a woman,  in a way that no one else ever had.
zh: 康纳对我信任的程度，我身为一个女人和撰稿人， 之前从未没有在别人那里得到过。

en: And he also created a magical atmosphere of trust between us  by confessing his secret,  which was that, as a very young boy starting at age four,  he had been savagely and repeatedly physically abused  by his stepfather,  and the abuse had gotten so bad that he had had to drop out of school in eighth grade,  even though he was very smart,  and he'd spent almost 20 years rebuilding his life.
zh: 通过透露他不为人知的秘密，他在我们之间营造了 奇特的相互信任的氛围。 他告诉我，他从四岁开始 他的继父就开始持续野蛮的 在身体上虐待他。 虐待的结果是如此之坏，使得他不得不在八年级的时候辍学， 尽管当时他十分的聪明。 他花了几乎20年的时间重建他的生活。

en: Which is why that Ivy League degree  and the Wall Street job and his bright shiny future  meant so much to him.
zh: 这也就是为什么常春藤大学的学位， 华尔街的工作和光明的未来， 对他意义重大。

en: If you had told me  that this smart, funny, sensitive man who adored me  would one day dictate whether or not I wore makeup,  how short my skirts were,  where I lived, what jobs I took,  who my friends were and where I spent Christmas,  I would have laughed at you,  because there was not a hint of violence or control  or anger in Conor at the beginning.
zh: 如果那时有人对我说 这个聪明、幽默、体贴并喜欢我的男人 会有一天命令我是否化妆， 我的裙子能多短， 我生活在哪，要做什么工作， 能和谁交朋友和在哪度过圣诞， 我会嘲笑你， 因为我在康纳身上看不出一点暴力或者控制欲 或者愤怒的预兆。

en: Now, Conor did not come home one day and announce,  "You know, hey, all this Romeo and Juliet stuff has been great,  but I need to move into the next phase  where I isolate you and I abuse you" —  —  "so I need to get you out of this apartment  where the neighbors can hear you scream  and out of this city where you have friends and family  and coworkers who can see the bruises."
zh: 康纳并不是回到家，向我宣布 “嘿，虽然罗曼蒂克之类的很棒， 但是我们要进入下一阶段了 我要孤立你然后虐待你。” “所以我要你离开你自己的公寓， 防止你的邻居他听见你的惨叫， 我还要让你离开这个有你的朋友、家人和同事的城市 不然他们会看到你的伤痕。”

en: Instead, Conor came home one Friday evening  and he told me that he had quit his job that day,  his dream job,  and he said that he had quit his job because of me,  because I had made him feel so safe and loved  that he didn't need to prove himself on Wall Street anymore,  and he just wanted to get out of the city  and away from his abusive, dysfunctional family,
zh: 事实是，康纳在一个周五的晚上回到家， 告诉我他辞掉了他的工作， 他梦寐以求的工作， 他说他是因为我才辞职， 我让他拥有了无比的幸福和安全感， 他再不需要到华尔街证明自己。 现在他只想离开这座城市， 原理那个充满虐待的、不正常的家庭，

en: and move to a tiny town in New England  where he could start his life over with me by his side.
zh: 搬到新英格兰的某个小镇 和我一起在那里开始新的生活。

en: Now, the last thing I wanted to do was leave New York,  and my dream job,  but I thought you made sacrifices for your soulmate,  so I agreed, and I quit my job,  and Conor and I left Manhattan together.
zh: 当时，我最不想做的就是离开纽约， 离开我热爱的工作， 但是为了自己灵魂伴侣，我想我需要做出牺牲。 所以我同意了，辞掉了工作， 跟康纳一起离开了曼哈顿。

en: I had no idea I was falling into crazy love,  that I was walking headfirst into a carefully laid  physical, financial and psychological trap.
zh: 我以为自己陷入了疯狂的爱情，还不知道 我已经懵懂的走进了一张精心编织的 控制你身体、心灵和经济的陷阱。

en: As soon as we moved to New England -- you know,  that place where Connor was supposed to feel so safe --  he bought three guns.
zh: 我们刚搬到新英格兰小镇 ——我想，康纳应该是觉得这里很安全—— 他就买了三支枪。

en: He kept one in the glove compartment of our car.
zh: 一支放在车子的置物箱里，

en: He kept one under the pillows on our bed,  and the third one he kept in his pocket at all times.
zh: 一支放在床的枕头下面， 第三支则一直放在口袋里。

en: And he said that he needed those guns  because of the trauma he'd experienced as a young boy.
zh: 他说小时候的精神创伤 使得他需要拥有这些枪

en: It was 7 a.m. I still had on my nightgown.
zh: 那是早上七点，我还穿着睡袍。

en: I was working on my computer trying to finish a freelance writing assignment,  and I got frustrated,  and Conor used my anger as an excuse  to put both of his hands around my neck  and to squeeze so tightly that I could not breathe or scream,  and he used the chokehold  to hit my head repeatedly against the wall.
zh: 我正在用电脑工作，想要完成自由职业撰稿的任务， 当时我有些烦躁， 康纳以我的愤怒为借口， 用双手掐住我的脖子， 死死的掐着，让我无法呼吸，喊不出声。 他从背后勒着我的脖子 一次一次的把我的头往墙上撞。

en: Five days later, the ten bruises on my neck had just faded,  and I put on my mother's wedding dress,  and I married him.
zh: 五天之后，脖子上的十个手指印刚消退， 我就穿上我妈妈的婚纱， 嫁给了他。

en: Despite what had happened,  I was sure we were going to live happily ever after,  because I loved him, and he loved me so much.
zh: 尽管发生了那些事情， 我还是相信我们以后能幸福的生活， 因为我们如此的相爱，也因为

en: He had just been really stressed out by the wedding  and by becoming a family with me.
zh: 他只是压力太大了，婚礼的筹备和 我家庭成员的到来让他喘不过气。

en: It was an isolated incident,  and he was never going to hurt me again.
zh: 这是一个意外， 而他以后不会再伤害我。

en: The first time, I was driving to find a secret beach  and I got lost,  and he punched me in the side of my head so hard  that the other side of my head repeatedly hit  the driver's side window.
zh: 第一次，我驾车去寻找秘密的海滩 我迷路了， 他（坐在副驾驶座上）不停的打我的头，打得如此的使劲 以至于我的头不断的撞到 驾驶座车门的玻璃。

en: And then a few days later, driving home from our honeymoon,  he got frustrated by traffic,  and he threw a cold Big Mac in my face.
zh: 没过几天，过完蜜月开车回家的路上 堵车让他很烦躁， 他把一个冰冷的巨无霸砸在我的脸上。

en: One in three American women  experiences domestic violence or stalking at some point in her life,  and the CDC reports that 15 million children  are abused every year, 15 million.
zh: 事实上，每三个美国女性中 就有一个曾是家庭暴力受害者或潜在的目标， 而CDC的报告称每年有1500万的儿童 遭受虐待，1500万。

en: Even though he held those loaded guns to my head,  pushed me down stairs,  threatened to kill our dog,  pulled the key out of the car ignition as I drove down the highway,  poured coffee grinds on my head  as I dressed for a job interview,  I never once thought of myself as a battered wife.
zh: 尽管他用上膛的枪指着我的头， 把我推下楼梯， 威胁杀掉我们的狗， 在高速公路上拔掉车钥匙， 在我为了面试而准备着装时 把咖啡粉从我头上倒下来， 我从来没有想过自己是一个受到虐待的妻子。

en: Instead, I was a very strong woman  in love with a deeply troubled man,  and I was the only person on Earth  who could help Conor face his demons.
zh: 正好相反，我是一个很强硬的女性 深爱着这个饱受困扰的男人， 而且我是这世上唯一一个 可以帮助康纳面对自己心魔的人。

en: To me, this is the saddest and most painful question that people ask,  because we victims know something you usually don't:  It's incredibly dangerous to leave an abuser.
zh: 对我来说，这是人们问过的最让我伤心和痛苦的问题， 你不能理解，但是只有我们受害者自己清楚 离开施虐者是多么的危险。

en: Over 70 percent of domestic violence murders  happen after the victim has ended the relationship,  after she's gotten out,  because then the abuser has nothing left to lose.
zh: 超过70%的家庭暴力谋杀 发生在受害者结束这段关系后， 在她离开之后， 因为施虐者已经毫无顾忌。

en: Other outcomes include long-term stalking,  even after the abuser remarries;  denial of financial resources;  and manipulation of the family court system  to terrify the victim and her children,  who are regularly forced by family court judges to spend unsupervised time  with the man who beat their mother.
zh: 其他可能的结果包括长期的跟踪， 甚至施虐者再婚之后（仍会跟踪）； 拒绝经济支持； 欺骗家庭法庭 来恐吓受害者和她的孩子。 孩子们通常会被家庭问题法官要求 和那个打他们母亲的男人 一起度过一段无人监管的时间。

en: I was able to leave,  because of one final, sadistic beating  that broke through my denial.
zh: 我之所以决定离开， 是因为最后一次残暴的殴打 突破了我能承受的极限。

en: I realized that the man who I loved so much  was going to kill me if I let him.
zh: 我意识到如果我不反抗，这个我曾 深爱的男人会杀掉我。

en: I told everyone:  the police, my neighbors,  my friends and family, total strangers,  and I'm here today because you all helped me.
zh: 我向所有人求助： 警察，邻居， 我的朋友和家人，完全陌生的人， 今天我能站在这里，因为你们每个人都帮助了我。

en: But since publishing "Crazy Love,"  I have heard hundreds of stories from men and women  who also got out,  who learned an invaluable life lesson from what happened,  and who rebuilt lives -- joyous, happy lives --  as employees, wives and mothers,  lives completely free of violence, like me.
zh: 但”Crazy Love”这本书出版之后， 很多男人和女人跟我诉说了他们的故事 他们也想告诉别人， 他们从发生的事情中学到了无价的一课， 他们重新开始了生活——开心快乐的生活—— 作为员工、妻子和母亲， 就像我现在一样生活，远离暴力。

en: Because it turns out that I'm actually a very typical domestic violence victim  and a typical domestic violence survivor.
zh: 实际上，我是典型的家庭暴力受害者， 也是典型的家庭暴力幸存者。

en: I remarried a kind and gentle man,  and we have those three kids.
zh: 我和一个温柔善良男人再次结婚， 有了三个孩子。

en: I have that black lab, and I have that minivan.
zh: 我养了一只黑色拉布拉多猎犬，开本田奥赛德面包车。

en: What I will never have again,  ever,  is a loaded gun held to my head  by someone who says that he loves me.
zh: 而我永远不会再拥有的， 永远 是一个嘴里说爱我的人用 上膛了的枪指着我的脑袋。

en: Right now, maybe you're thinking,  "Wow, this is fascinating,"  or, "Wow, how stupid was she,"  but this whole time, I've actually been talking about you.
zh: 此时此刻，你可能在想， 哇，这才神奇了， 或者，“喔，她真蠢，” 但是在整个过程中，事实上，我在谈论的是你。

en: I promise you there are several people  listening to me right now  who are currently being abused  or who were abused as children  or who are abusers themselves.
zh: 我敢保证，现在正在听我说话的人中 有一些人 正遭受着虐待 或者曾经在小时候被虐待过 或者你就是一个施虐者。

en: It's my way of helping other victims,  and it's my final request of you.
zh: 这是我帮助其他的受害者的方式， 同时也是我对你们最后的请求。

en: You have the power to end domestic violence  simply by shining a spotlight on it.
zh: 你有能力制止家庭暴力 只需要点亮星星之火。

en: We victims need everyone.
zh: 我们受害者需要每一个人的帮助。

en: Recast survivors as wonderful, lovable people  with full futures.
zh: 帮助幸存者重新找回美好、可爱的自己， 重新拥有未来。

en: Recognize the early signs of violence  and conscientiously intervene,  deescalate it, show victims a safe way out.
zh: 发现家庭暴力的预兆 并认真的干预， 减少发生的可能性，给受害者提供安全的出路。

en: Together we can make our beds,  our dinner tables and our families  the safe and peaceful oases they should be.
zh: 让我们携起手来， 让我们的床，我们餐桌和家庭 成为它们应该成为的安全、和平的绿洲。

en: Thank you.
zh: 谢谢。

en: And I feel like  there's an uncomfortable tension in the room right now  because I should not have worn this dress.   So luckily, I brought an outfit change.
zh: 现在，我在这个房间内感到一种 令人不适的紧张感 因为我不该穿这条裙子 幸亏我带了另外一套

en: This is the first outfit change on the TED stage,  so you guys are pretty lucky to witness it, I think.
zh: 这是TED讲台上第一次现场换装 所以我觉得今天在场的人都很幸运啊，

en: If some of the women were really horrified when I came out,  you don't have to tell me now, but I'll find out later on Twitter.
zh: 如果有些女士对的我出现感到惊恐 不必现在告诉我。但我马上就会在twitter上知道的

en: Not everybody gets to do that.
zh: 这不是所有人都能做得到的

en: The worst part is putting this sweater over my head,  because that's when you'll all laugh at me,  so don't do anything while it's over my head.
zh: 最坏的消息是我要把这件毛衣从头上套进去 因为这时候你们会笑我 所以当我穿衣服的时候,什么都不要做

en: I just totally transformed what you thought of me, in six seconds.
zh: 我只是在6秒内就彻底改变了自己在你们心中的形象

en: I was totally uncomfortable,  and the photographer was telling me to arch my back  and put my hand in that guy's hair.
zh: 当摄影师 要我弓起背，摸那个男士的头发时 我非常不自在

en: And of course, barring surgery,  or the fake tan that I got two days ago for work,  there's very little that we can do to transform how we look,  and how we look, though it is superficial and immutable,  has a huge impact on our lives.
zh: 确定的是，除了手术 或像两天前我为了工作做的棕褐色 我们基本上是没法改变外表的 我们的外表，虽然是表面化的，固定的 还是极大地影响着我们的生活

en: And I am on this stage because I am a model.
zh: 今天我站在这里是因为我是个模特

en: I am on this stage because I am a pretty, white woman,  and in my industry, we call that a sexy girl.
zh: 我在这个舞台上是因为我是个漂亮的白种女性 在我们业内我们称此为“性感女孩”

en: I'm going to answer the questions that people always ask me,  but with an honest twist.
zh: 我要回答下人们常常问我的那些问题 以一种诚实的方式

en: The real way that I became a model  is I won a genetic lottery, and I am the recipient of a legacy,  and maybe you're wondering what is a legacy.
zh: 我成为模特的真正的原因是 我拥有极佳的基因，我是遗产的接受者 你可能在疑问什么是遗产.

en: And this is a legacy that was built for me,  and it's a legacy that I've been cashing out on.
zh: 这就是我的遗产， 这就是我一直在兑现的遗产，

en: And I know there are people in the audience  who are skeptical at this point,  and maybe there are some fashionistas who are like,  "Wait. Naomi. Tyra. Joan Smalls. Liu Wen."
zh: 我知道你们中有些人 可能对这个观点存疑 你们可能会举出一些时尚圈人物，例如 Naomi, Tyra, Joan Smalls和Liu Wen

en: And first, I commend you on your model knowledge. Very impressive.
zh: 首先，我要表扬下你们对于模特界的了解令人印象深刻

en: But unfortunately, I have to inform you that in 2007,  a very inspired NYU Ph.D. student  counted all the models on the runway, every single one that was hired,  and of the 677 models that were hired,  only 27, or less than four percent, were non-white.
zh: 但不幸的是，我得告诉你们，在2007年时 一名纽约大学的博士在启发之下 统计了所有在职模特的人数 在677名正式受雇模特中 只有27名，也就是不到百分之四，是非白种人

en: But the second answer, and what I really want to say to these little girls is,  "Why? You know? You can be anything.
zh: 但第二个答案，也是我想对问问题的那些小姑娘说的是“为什么？” 你知道吗？你可以选择任何的职业。

en: Because I'm not in charge of anything,  and you could be the editor in chief of American Vogue  or the CEO of H&M, or the next Steven Meisel.
zh: 因为我不能决定任何事 你可以成为美国Vogue杂志的主编 或是H&M的首席执行官，或下一个Steven Meisel

en: Saying that you want to be a model when you grow up  is akin to saying that you want to win the Powerball when you grow up.
zh: 说你长大后想当模特 就像你说你长大后想赢彩票一样

en: It's out of your control, and it's awesome,  and it's not a career path.
zh: （能不能成为模特）不在你的掌控范围之内。当模特很棒 但它不是一个可规划的行业

en: I will demonstrate for you now 10 years of accumulated model knowledge,  because unlike cardiothoracic surgeons,  it can just be distilled right now.
zh: 我将为大家展示我模特从业十年的一些经验 因为不像一个忍者般的心胸科诗人 它只能立足当下

en: So, if the photographer is right there,  the light is right there, like a nice HMI,  and the client says, "We want a walking shot,"  this leg goes first, nice and long, this arm goes back, this arm goes forward,  the head is at three quarters, and you just go back and forth,  just do that, and then you look back at your imaginary friends,  300, 400, 500 times.   It will look something like this.
zh: 所以如果摄影师就在这里 灯光就在这里--比如漂亮的水银灯 客户说：“Cameron,我想要一张走路时的快门照” 这条修长的美腿先迈步，这条手臂放在后面，这条手臂放前面 露出四分之三侧脸，来来回回， 就这样，然后回头看你臆想中的朋友 300，400，500次 这看上去就像这样

en: That was -- I don't know what happened there.
zh: 我不知道那张是怎么回事儿

en: Unfortunately, after you've gone to school,  and you have a résumé and you've done a few jobs,  you can't say anything anymore,  so if you say you want to be the President of the United States,  but your résumé reads, "Underwear Model: 10 years,"  people give you a funny look.
zh: 现实是，当你毕业后 有了简历，做过了几份工作 你就不能再说其它的了 所以如果你说你想成为美国总统 但你的简历上写着：有十年工作经验的内衣模特 人们会笑着看你

en: And yeah, they pretty much retouch all the photos,  but that is only a small component of what's happening.
zh: 是的，他们会修几乎所有照片 但这只是工作的一小部分

en: This picture is the very first picture that I ever took,  and it's also the very first time that I had worn a bikini,  and I didn't even have my period yet.
zh: 这是我第一张模特照片 也是我第一次穿比基尼 我基至还没有过月经

en: This is what I looked like with my grandma just a few months earlier.
zh: 这是那张照片几个月前我跟祖母一起拍的照片

en: Here's me on the same day as this shoot.
zh: 这是拍照片当天

en: My friend got to come.
zh: 我朋友跟我在一起

en: Here's me at a slumber party a few days before I shot French Vogue.
zh: 这是我拍法国Vogue杂志前几天前在睡衣party上拍的照片

en: And I hope what you're seeing  is that these pictures are not pictures of me.
zh: 我希望你们明白的是 这些不是我自己的照片

en: They are constructions,  and they are constructions by a group of professionals,  by hairstylists and makeup artists and photographers and stylists  and all of their assistants and pre-production and post-production,  and they build this. That's not me.
zh: 而是 由一群专业人士制出的图象, 发型师，化装师，摄影师，造型师 以及他们的助理，还有前期制作，后期制作 他们制造出了这些图象，而不是我

en: Okay, so the next question people always ask me is,  "Do you get free stuff?"
zh: 下一个问题是 “你能得到免费的东西吗？”

en: I do have too many 8-inch heels which I never get to wear,  except for earlier,  but the free stuff that I get is the free stuff that I get in real life, and that's what we don't like to talk about.
zh: 我确实有太多 从没机会穿的8英寸高跟鞋， 但是免费的东西 却是我在现实生活中得到的。而这恰恰是我们不愿意谈的

en: I grew up in Cambridge,  and one time I went into a store and I forgot my money  and they gave me the dress for free.
zh: 我在剑桥市长大 有一次我走进一家商店却忘了带钱 他们送了我一条裙子

en: When I was a teenager, I was driving with my friend  who was an awful driver and she ran a red and of course,  we got pulled over,  and all it took was a "Sorry, officer," and we were on our way.
zh: 十几岁时，我跟朋友一起开车 她是个糟糕的司机，闯了红灯 我们被停车 我只说了句：“长官抱歉” 我们就继续上路了

en: And I got these free things because of how I look,  not who I am, and there are people paying a cost  for how they look and not who they are.
zh: 我得到这些是因为我的外表 而不是我是身份。有些人为了他们的外表 而不是身份付出了代价。

en: I live in New York, and last year,  of the 140,000 teenagers that were stopped and frisked,  86% of them were black and Latino, and most of them were young men.
zh: 我住在纽约，去年 有14万青年被停车搜身 他们中百分之86是黑人和拉美人 大多数是年轻的男孩子

en: And there are only 177,000 young black and Latino men in New York,  so for them, it's not a question of, "Will I get stopped?"
zh: 而在纽约年轻黑人和拉美男性总数只有17万7千 所以，对他们来说，问题不是：“我会被停车吗”

en: When I was researching this talk,  I found out that of the 13-year-old girls in the United States,  53% don't like their bodies,  and that number goes to 78% by the time that they're 17.
zh: 我在为这次演讲做调查时 发现在美国13岁女孩儿群体中 百分之53不喜欢她们的身体 到了17岁，这一比例上升至百分之78。

en: So, the last question people ask me is,  "What is it like to be a model?"
zh: 那么最后一个问题是 ”当模特是什么感觉？“

en: And when we're backstage,  we give an answer that maybe makes it seem like that.
zh: 当在后台时,我们会给出一个 像这样的答案。

en: We say, "It's really amazing to travel, and it's amazing to get to work  with creative, inspired, passionate people."
zh: 我们说”能到处旅行 和有创造力的，热情的，灵感不断的人一起工作真的很棒”

en: And those things are true, but they're only one half of the story,  because the thing that we never say on camera,  that I have never said on camera, is,  "I am insecure."
zh: 这不假，但这只是事实的一半 因为我们永远不会在镜头前说的是, 我永远不会说的是, “我没有安全感“

en: And I'm insecure because I have to think about what I look like every day.
zh: 因为我必须每天都要担心 我看上去怎么样

en: When I was writing this talk,  I found it very difficult to strike an honest balance, because on the one hand,  I felt very uncomfortable to come out here and say,  "Look I've received all these benefits from a deck stacked in my favor,"  and it also felt really uncomfortable to follow that up with,  "and it doesn't always make me happy."
zh: 所以当我为这次演讲做准备时时，发现 很难为诚实找到一个平衡点。因为一方面 如果我站在这儿，说 ”看，我凭着天生的优势得到了这么多东西，”心里会不舒服 可是如果这句话接着 “可是这些都不能让我开心”也很不自在

en: But mostly it was difficult to unpack a legacy of gender and racial oppression  when I am one of the biggest beneficiaries.
zh: 但最难的是去展现 性别和种族歧视的职业传统 因为我自己本身是最大的受益者

en: But I'm also happy and honored to be up here  before 10 or 20 or 30 years had passed and I'd had more agency in my career,  because maybe then I wouldn't tell the story of how I got my first job,  or maybe I wouldn't tell the story of how I paid for college,  which seems so important right now.
zh: 但同时我又很开心并受尊重的站在这里 趁着我还年轻，而不是已经工作了10，20或30年 和模特行业间有越来越多的阻隔（不能获得最直接的感觉） 因为可能到那时我就不会讲我怎样得到第一份工作 怎样付大学学费 这些现在看来是如此重要的东西

en: If there's a takeaway to this talk,  I hope it's that we all feel more comfortable acknowledging  the power of image in our perceived successes  and our perceived failures.
zh: 如果这次演讲能使你有所受益，我希望 是我们都能欣然接受 图象的力量带来的我们所理解的成功 和我们所理解的失败

en: Thank you.
zh: 谢谢

en: ever since I was old enough to pick up a camera,  but today I want to share with you  the 15 most treasured photos of mine,  and I didn't take any of them.
zh: 自从我足够大拿起相机以来， 我一直热衷摄影， 但我今天想和你们分享 15张我最珍爱的照片， 它们没有一张是我拍的。

en: There were no art directors, no stylists,  no chance for reshoots, not even any regard for lighting.
zh: 没有艺术指导，没有造型师， 没有重拍的机会，更别提灯光效果。

en: Well you can see where this is going.
zh: 你可以猜到事情是怎么发展的。

en: Approaching my daughter's third birthday,  my wife said, "Hey, why don't you take Sabina back to New York  and make it a father-daughter trip, and continue the ritual?"
zh: 接近女儿三岁生日时， 妻子说，“嘿，你为什么不带萨比娜回纽约， 来个父女之旅，继续这个小传统？”

en: Back then, we had no idea how much this trip would change our lives.
zh: 那时，我们并不知道这样的旅程会深深改变我们的生活。

en: This one was taken just weeks after 9/11,  and I found myself trying to explain what had happened that day  in ways a five-year-old could understand.
zh: 这张是在911的几周后拍的， 我那时尝试解释911那天发生的事 试图采用让这个五岁孩子明白的方式。

en: This very focused time we get to spend together  is something we cherish and anticipate the entire year.
zh: 这是我们亲子相处的时间， 是一年里面我们最珍惜也最期待的时间。

en: Recently, on one trip, we were walking,  and she stops dead in her tracks,  and she points to a red awning of the doll store  that she loved when she was little  on our earlier trips.
zh: 最近一次旅程，我们在路上走着， 她突然停了下来， 她指着一间玩偶店的红色外棚 说她小时候非常喜欢那外棚 也就是从我们之前的旅程开始。

en: She said she remembers her heart bursting out of her chest  when she saw that place for the very first time  nine years earlier.
zh: 她说她记得第一次看到那个地方时 她的心快要跳出来， 那是9年前的事了。

en: And now what she's looking at in New York  are colleges,  because she's determined to go to school in New York.
zh: 现在她去纽约关注的是 大学校园， 因为她决定要去纽约读书。

en: And it hit me: One of the most important things  we all make are memories.
zh: 我突然明白：我们创造的最重要的事情之一 是我们的记忆。

en: I don't know about you, but aside from these 15 shots,  I'm not in many of the family photos.
zh: 我不知道你们的情况，但我个人而言，除了这15张照片， 我不会经常出现在家庭照片里面。

en: I'm always the one taking the picture.
zh: 我总是那个拿相机拍照的人。

en: So I want to encourage everyone today  to get in the shot,  and don't hesitate to go up to someone and ask,  "Will you take our picture?"
zh: 我希望鼓励今天在座的各位， 争取到照片里面去， 别犹豫，走向前问路人， “可以帮我们拍照吗？”

en: Thank you.
zh: 谢谢。

en: There are 10,000 species of birds in the world.
zh: 地球上总共有一万种鸟类。

en: Vultures are amongst the most threatened group of birds.
zh: 秃鹫是他们中最濒临灭绝的一种。

en: When you see a vulture like this, the first thing  that comes to your mind is, these are disgusting, ugly,  greedy creatures that are just after your flesh,  associated with politicians.    I want to change that perception. I want to change  those feelings you have for these birds, because  they need our sympathy. They really do.   And I'll tell you why.
zh: 每当你看到秃鹫就像这只，首先 浮现在你脑海中一定是，这是一些令人厌恶， 贪得无厌并且追逐腐肉的可怕生物， 让人禁不住联想到政客们。 我想改变这种看法。我想改变 大家对秃鹫的这些不好的联想，因为 他们需要我们的同情。他们真的很需要。 让我来告诉大家为什么。

en: When Charles Darwin went across the Atlantic in 1832  on the Beagle, he saw the turkey vulture,  and he said, "These are disgusting birds  with bald scarlet heads that are formed to revel in putridity."   You could not get a worse insult, and that from Charles Darwin.   You know, he changed his mind when he came back,  and I'll tell you why.
zh: 1832年 查尔斯 达尔文在搭乘贝格尔号穿越大西洋的 旅途中，发现了土耳其秃鹫， 他当时说道，“这些令人恶心的，长着猩红色 秃头的鸟儿们总是沉湎于腐肉中不可自拔." 你很难找到比这更恶毒的侮辱了，这些话可是查尔斯 达尔文说的。 你们知道吗，达尔文返回英国之后就改变他的看法， 我马上会告诉你们为什么。

en: They've also be associated with Disney —  —  personified as goofy, dumb, stupid characters.
zh: 秃鹫还曾经被迪斯尼看上—— 像高飞狗一样，被人格化，变成了麻木的，愚蠢的动画角色。

en: More recently, if you've been following the Kenyan press  —    —  these are the attributes that they associated  the Kenyan MPs with. But I want to challenge that.
zh: 而最近，如果你留意过肯尼亚的新闻 ——（欢呼）—— 肯尼亚的国会议员们被讽刺为像秃鹫一般 贪婪和愚蠢。但是我想叫板它。

en: They are hardly monogamous.    They are far from being extinct.   And, my favorite is, vultures are better looking.    So there's two types of vultures in this planet.
zh: 几乎没人遵守一夫一妻制度。 他们离灭绝还很远。 并且，这条我最喜欢，秃鹫比议员们好看多了。 在这个世界上有两大类秃鹫。

en: There are the New World vultures that are mainly found  in the Americas, like the condors and the caracaras,  and then the Old World vultures, where we have  16 species. From these 16, 11 of them are facing  a high risk of extinction.
zh: 新大陆的秃鹫主要生长在 美洲大陆，像是美洲秃鹫和委内瑞拉秃鹫， 而在其他的大陆，那里 总共有16种秃鹫，他们中的11种正面临着 灭绝的风险。

en: So why are vultures important? First of all,  they provide vital ecological services. They clean up.
zh: 所以为什么说秃鹫重要呢？首先， 秃鹫对生态循环做出了至关重要的作用。他们净化环境。

en: They're our natural garbage collectors.
zh: 秃鹫是我们的大自然垃圾清道夫。

en: They help to kill all the bacteria. They help absorb anthrax  that would otherwise spread and cause  huge livestock losses and diseases in other animals.
zh: 他们能消灭所有尸体上的细菌，他们能吸收炭疽病毒 阻止病毒的传播与扩散 从而使大量的家畜和动物远离死亡和疾病。

en: Recent studies have shown that in areas where there are  no vultures, carcasses take up to three to four times  to decompose, and this has huge ramifications for the spread of diseases.
zh: 最近的研究还显示在那些 没有秃鹫生存的地区，尸体的分解会多花 三到四倍的时间，这给疾病的传播与扩散

en: In Hindu mythology, Jatayu was the vulture god,  and he risked his life in order to save the goddess Sita  from the 10-headed demon Ravana.
zh: 在印度教神话中，秃鹫之神名为雅达尤， 他冒着生命危险 从10头恶魔罗波那手中救出了西妲女神。

en: In Tibetan culture, they are performing very important  sky burials. In places like Tibet, there are no places  to bury the dead, or wood to cremate them,  so these vultures provide a natural disposal system.
zh: 在西藏文化中，秃鹫尤其显得重要 天葬。在那些类似西藏的地方，既没有条件 土葬，也没有木材去进行火葬， 所以秃鹫为当地人提供了一种天然的尸体处理系统。

en: So what is the problem with vultures?
zh: 那么秃鹫都面临着哪些问题呢？

en: We have eight species of vultures that occur in Kenya,  of which six are highly threatened with extinction.
zh: 肯尼亚生长着八种秃鹫， 其中的六种正濒临灭绝。

en: The reason is that they're getting poisoned, and the reason  that they're getting poisoned is because there's  human-wildlife conflicts. The pastoral communities  are using this poison to target predators,  and in return, the vultures are falling victim to this.
zh: 很多秃鹫被毒死，中毒的原因 是因为在肯尼亚正在发生的 人类与野生动物之间对于生存空间的争夺。牧人们 使用毒药来对付掠食动物， 掠食动物被毒死之后，秃鹫们随之成为了下一个受害者。

en: In South Asia, in countries like India and Pakistan,  four species of vultures are listed as critically endangered,  which means they have less than 10 or 15 years to go extinct,  and the reason is because they are falling prey  by consuming livestock that has been treated  with a painkilling drug like Diclofenac.
zh: 在南亚，一些国家类似于印度和巴基斯坦， 四种秃鹫被列为极度濒临灭绝中， 这意味着在他们将会在10到15年之内彻底灭绝， 灭绝的原因是因为秃鹫们 食用了那些生前曾被喂食过 含有双氯芬酸成分止疼药的家畜。

en: This drug has now been banned for veterinary use in India,  and they have taken a stand.
zh: 现在含有双氯芬酸的兽药已经被禁止在印度使用， 印度政府表现出了积极的态度。

en: Because there are no vultures, there's been a spread  in the numbers of feral dogs at carcass dump sites,  and when you have feral dogs, you have a huge time bomb  of rabies. The number of cases of rabies  has increased tremendously in India.
zh: 因为秃鹫数量的骤减，野狗开始 在牲畜尸体掩埋场周围泛滥成灾， 在野狗泛滥的地区，狂犬病就像定时炸弹一样 随时都会爆发。狂犬病案例的数量 在印度出现了惊人的增长。

en: I am not against wind energy, but we need to work  with the governments, because wind turbines  do this to birds. They slice them in half.
zh: 我不反对开发风能，但是我们应该呼吁 政府重新考虑这项决定，因为风力涡轮机 会对鸟类造成威胁。高速的扇叶会把鸟儿“切”成两半。

en: In West Africa, there's a horrific trade  of dead vultures to serve the witchcraft and the fetish market.
zh: 在西非，一些人毫无怜悯的叫卖 死去的秃鹫来满足巫术和收藏的需求。

en: So what's being done? Well, we're conducting research  on these birds. We're putting transmitters on them.
zh: 我们正在做什么呢？我们正在研究 这些秃鹫。我们在它们身上安装定位器。

en: We're trying to determine their basic ecology,  and see where they go.
zh: 我们试图去查明秃鹫与周围环境的关系 并且了解秃鹫的行踪。

en: We can see that they travel different countries, so  if you focus on a problem locally, it's not going to help you.
zh: 我们发现它们会在不同的国家之间旅行，所以 如果只是关注一个地区，你很难取得什么进展。

en: We're talking to them about appreciating vultures,  about the need from within to appreciate these  wonderful creatures and the services that they provide.
zh: 我们正在尽力让他们了解到秃鹫的益处， 并且发自内心得去感激这些 奇妙的生物和他们为自然所做的贡献。

en: How can you help? You can become active,  make noise. You can write a letter to your government  and tell them that we need to focus on these very  misunderstood creatures. Volunteer your time  to spread the word. Spread the word.
zh: 你们能做些什么呢？你们可以行动起来， 制造声势。你们可以写信给你们的政府 并且告诉他们，我们需要去关注这些被严重 误解的生物。花些时间 告诉你身边的人。尽可能多的人。

en: When you walk out of this room, you will be informed  about vultures, but speak to your families, to your children,  to your neighbors about vultures.
zh: 当你走出这个房间的时候，你们就是 秃鹫达人了，不但要告诉你的家人们，还要 告诉你们的邻居们有关秃鹫的故事。

en: They are very graceful. Charles Darwin said  he changed his mind because he watched them fly  effortlessly without energy in the skies.
zh: 它们是那么的优雅。查尔斯 达尔文曾说到 他改变了自己的看法，在他看到秃鹫们在空中 优雅而又浑然天成的身姿之后。

en: Thank you very much.
zh: 非常感谢。（鼓掌）

en: Everything I do, and everything I do professionally --  my life -- has been shaped  by seven years of work as a young man in Africa.
zh: 我所做的一切，不论是生活上还是工作上 我的整个人生--深深受到 年轻时在非洲工作的那七年的影响，

en: I worked for an Italian NGO,  and every single project that we set up in Africa  failed.
zh: 当时我在一家意大利非政府组织工作。 我们在非洲建立的每一个项目， 都失败了。

en: Instead, everything we touched we killed.
zh: 然而，我们干什么赔什么。

en: Our first project, the one that has inspired my first book,  "Ripples from the Zambezi,"  was a project where we Italians  decided to teach Zambian people how to grow food.
zh: 我们第一个项目给了我写第一本书的灵感， 书名叫《赞比西河的涟漪》。 在这个项目中，我们意大利人 决定教赞比亚人种粮食。

en: And of course the local people had absolutely no interest  in doing that, so we paid them to come and work,  and sometimes they would show up.   And we were amazed that the local people, in such a fertile valley, would not have any agriculture.
zh: 当然，当地人对此表示毫无兴趣， 所以我们付工资请他们来劳作， 他们也是一会儿来一会儿不来的。 有着如此肥沃的山谷，当地人居然不耕种，

en: But instead of asking them how come they were not  growing anything, we simply said, "Thank God we're here."   "Just in the nick of time to save the Zambian people from starvation."
zh: 我们对此感到十分惊奇。 但我们并没有问他们原因， 而仅仅是感叹道：“幸亏我们来了。” “在饥饿的赞比亚人民命悬一线时伸出了援手。”

en: And of course, everything in Africa grew beautifully.
zh: 当然，在非洲种的东西都长得很好。

en: When the tomatoes were nice and ripe and red,  overnight, some 200 hippos came out from the river  and they ate everything.   And we said to the Zambians, "My God, the hippos!"
zh: 当西红柿成熟了，红彤彤的好看极了， 一夜之间，从赞比西河跑来两百多头河马 把所有西红柿都啃光了。 我们跟赞比亚人说：“天呐，这些该死的河马！”

en: I thought it was only us Italians blundering around Africa,  but then I saw what the Americans were doing,  what the English were doing, what the French were doing,  and after seeing what they were doing,  I became quite proud of our project in Zambia.
zh: 我本以为只有我们意大利人在非洲栽了跟头， 但当我知道美国人的情况， 英国人的情况，法国人的情况， 当看了他们的所作所为之后， 我为我们在赞比亚的项目感到非常自豪。

en: Because, you see, at least we fed the hippos.
zh: 因为，我们至少喂饱了河马。

en: You should see the rubbish —  --  You should see the rubbish that we have bestowed  on unsuspecting African people.
zh: 你们应该看看这些垃圾---- 你们应该看看我们塞了多少垃圾给 这些满怀信任的非洲人民。

en: I'm not going to tell you the damage that that money has done.
zh: 我不打算跟你们细说这笔钱所造成的损害。

en: Just go and read her book.
zh: 你们自己去读读看。

en: Read it from an African woman, the damage that we have done.
zh: 看看以一位非洲女性的眼光，我们所带来的损害有多大。

en: We Western people are imperialist, colonialist missionaries,  and there are only two ways we deal with people:  We either patronize them, or we are paternalistic.
zh: 我们西方人是帝国主义者，殖民主义者，以及传教士， 我们跟人们打交道的方式只有两种： 一是居高临下，二是家长做派。

en: The two words come from the Latin root "pater,"  which means "father."
zh: 这两个词来自于拉丁词根“pater”， 意即“父亲”。

en: But they mean two different things.
zh: 但两个词的意思不同。

en: Paternalistic, I treat anybody from a different culture  as if they were my children. "I love you so much."
zh: 家长做派意味着我把不同文化背景的人 当成我的孩子对待。“我爱你孩子。”

en: Patronizing, I treat everybody from another culture  as if they were my servants.
zh: 居高临下意味着我把另一文化背景的人 当做我的仆人对待。

en: I was given a slap in the face reading a book,  "Small is Beautiful," written by Schumacher, who said,  above all in economic development, if people  do not wish to be helped, leave them alone.
zh: 我在读一本书时，如遭当头棒喝， 这本书叫《小即是美》，作者是舒马赫， 他说，经济发展最重要的一点是，如果人们 不想让别人帮忙，就随他们去。

en: This morning, the gentleman who opened this conference  lay a stick on the floor, and said,  "Can we -- can you imagine a city  that is not neocolonial?"
zh: 今天早上，给这次大会致开幕词的先生 在地上放了一根棍子，说道， “我们能不能--你们能不能想象一座城市 没被新殖民主义侵略吗？”

en: I decided when I was 27 years old  to only respond to people,  and I invented a system called Enterprise Facilitation,  where you never initiate anything,  you never motivate anybody, but you become a servant  of the local passion, the servant of local people  who have a dream to become a better person.
zh: 27岁时，我做出一个决定， 只基于人们的需求提供援助。 我创立了一套工作系统，叫“企业梦工厂”。 我们不做创始人， 也不激励任何人，而是为当地人们的 创业热情而服务，为当地人们 找到更好的人生定位。

en: So what you do -- you shut up.
zh: 所以我们要做的--就是闭嘴。

en: We meet at the cafe. We meet at the pub.
zh: 我们与客户在餐馆和酒吧见面。

en: And what we do, we become friends,  and we find out what that person wants to do.
zh: 我们所做的，是跟他们交朋友， 并发现他们的兴趣和意向。

en: If that person doesn't want to do it,  what are you going to do?
zh: 但如果对方不感兴趣， 你又有什么办法？

en: The passion that the person has for her own growth  is the most important thing.
zh: 客户热衷于自我提升的这份热情 才是最重要的。

en: And then we help them to go and find the knowledge,  because nobody in the world can succeed alone.
zh: 然后我们帮助他们搜集相关知识和信息， 因为这世上，单丝不成线，独木不成林。

en: The person with the idea may not have the knowledge,  but the knowledge is available.
zh: 有点子的人未必懂得相关知识， 但我们可以提供支持。

en: So years and years ago, I had this idea:  Why don't we, for once, instead of arriving in the community  to tell people what to do, why don't, for once,  listen to them? But not in community meetings.
zh: 所以很多年前，我有个想法， 我们为何不能至少有一次做到聆听他们的想法， 而不是把我们的想法强加于他们？ 但这不能以社区会议的形式进行。

en: There is a problem with community meetings.
zh: 社区会议存在一个问题。

en: Entrepreneurs never come,  and they never tell you, in a public meeting,  what they want to do with their own money,  what opportunity they have identified.
zh: 企业家们从不出席， 他们绝不会在公众集会上告诉你， 他们打算把钱用在哪儿， 他们窥测到了什么商机。

en: The smartest people in your community you don't even know,  because they don't come to your public meetings.
zh: 你甚至都无从结识社区里最聪明的那些人 因为他们根本不参与你们的公众集会。

en: What we do, we work one-on-one,  and to work one-on-one, you have to create  a social infrastructure that doesn't exist.
zh: 我们的做法是，与客户一对一， 为了能一对一，我们必须建设 一套前所未有的社会基础设施。

en: The profession is the family doctor of enterprise,  the family doctor of business, who sits with you  in your house, at your kitchen table, at the cafe,  and helps you find the resources to transform your passion  into a way to make a living.
zh: 这种职业相当于企业的家庭医生， 这位企业家庭医生，会与你面对面 在你的家里，你的厨房餐桌旁，或是咖啡馆， 帮助你集结资源来将你的创业热情 转换为谋生技能。

en: I started this as a tryout in Esperance, in Western Australia.
zh: 我在西澳大利亚州的埃斯佩兰斯进行了试验。

en: I was a doing a Ph.D. at the time,  trying to go away from this patronizing bullshit  that we arrive and tell you what to do.
zh: 那时我在读博士， 努力摒弃那种居高临下的狗屁做法 到了之后只会颐指气使指手划脚。

en: And so what I did in Esperance that first year  was to just walk the streets, and in three days  I had my first client, and I helped this first guy  who was smoking fish from a garage, was a Maori guy,  and I helped him to sell to the restaurant in Perth,  to get organized, and then the fishermen came to me to say,  "You the guy who helped Maori? Can you help us?"
zh: 我在埃斯佩兰斯的第一年 只是出去遛街，在那些日子里， 我有了第一位客户，我帮助了这第一个人。 他是毛利人，在一家车库里做熏鱼。 我教他把鱼卖给珀斯的餐馆， 帮他进行了筹划。然后当地的渔民们跑来跟我说， “你就是那个帮毛利佬卖鱼的人？你能帮帮我们吗？”

en: And I helped these five fishermen to work together  and get this beautiful tuna not to the cannery in Albany  for 60 cents a kilo, but we found a way  to take the fish for sushi to Japan for 15 dollars a kilo,  and the farmers came to talk to me, said,  "Hey, you helped them. Can you help us?"
zh: 我让这五个渔民合伙运作， 不是把美味的金枪鱼以60美分一公斤的低价 卖给奥尔巴尼的罐头工厂， 而是以15美元一公斤的高价卖给日本做寿司。 接着又有农民跑来跟我说， “嘿，你帮助了他们，能帮帮我们吗？”

en: In a year, I had 27 projects going on,  and the government came to see me to say,  "How can you do that?
zh: 一年之内，我做了27个项目， 政府的人跑来问我， “你是怎么办到的？

en: How can you do — ?" And I said, "I do something very, very, very difficult.
zh: 你怎么能--？”我答道：“我做了一件很困难的事，

en: I shut up, and listen to them."   So —  —  So the government says, "Do it again."   We've done it in 300 communities around the world.
zh: 那就是闭上嘴，听他们说。” 所以---- 所以政府的人说：“那接着做。” 我们在世界上300个社区开展了这个项目。

en: There is a new generation of entrepreneurs  who are dying of solitude.
zh: 新一代的创业者们 皆因闭门造车而一事无成。

en: Peter Drucker was a professor of philosophy  before becoming involved in business,  and this is what Peter Drucker says:  "Planning is actually incompatible  with an entrepreneurial society and economy."
zh: 彼得·德鲁克在涉足商界之前 是一位哲学教授， 彼得·德鲁克曾说过： “计划其实是与创业型社会 及创业型经济不相容的。”

en: So now you're rebuilding Christchurch  without knowing what the smartest people in Christchurch  want to do with their own money and their own energy.
zh: 现在，我们重建基督城， 却不知道基督城最聪明的那群人 想如何运用他们自己的钱财和精力。

en: Which presentation have you applauded the most this morning?
zh: 今天上午你们鼓掌最多的演讲来自谁？

en: Local, passionate people. That's who you have applauded.
zh: 是充满创业热情的当地人。你们为他们鼓掌。

en: So what I'm saying is that  entrepreneurship is where it's at.
zh: 所以我想说的是， 创业精神是当今社会的潮流。

en: We are at the end of the first industrial revolution --  nonrenewable fossil fuels, manufacturing --  and all of a sudden, we have systems which are not sustainable.
zh: 当我们处于第一次工业革命的末期时-- 我们使用不可再生矿物燃料，发展制造业-- 但我们忽然意识到这种发展是不可持续的。

en: What we have to look at is at how we  for seven billion people in a sustainable way.
zh: 我们现在要关心的是我们如何 以一种可持续的发展方式来满足70亿人的 食物、医疗、教育、运输及通信需求。

en: The technologies do not exist to do that.
zh: 现有的科技水平尚做不到这一点。

en: Who is going to invent the technology  for the green revolution? Universities? Forget about it!
zh: 谁能发明这种科技来 实现绿色革命？大学吗？别想了！

en: Government? Forget about it!
zh: 政府吗？别想了！

en: It will be entrepreneurs, and they're doing it now.
zh: 是创业者们，是他们正在为之奋斗。

en: There's a lovely story that I read in a futurist magazine  many, many years ago.
zh: 许多年前，我在一本未来主义杂志上 看过一篇有趣的文章。

en: There was a group of experts who were invited  to discuss the future of the city of New York in 1860.
zh: 1860年，有一批专家受到邀请 去讨论纽约市的未来是怎样。

en: Why? Because they looked at the curve and said,  if the population keeps growing at this rate,  to move the population of New York around,  they would have needed six million horses,  and the manure created by six million horses  would be impossible to deal with.
zh: 为什么？因为他们看着图表上的曲线说， 如果人口继续以这种速度增长， 纽约的人们出行 将需要六百万匹马， 而六百万匹马所排泄的粪便 将无法处理。

en: They were already drowning in manure.   So 1860, they are seeing this dirty technology  that is going to choke the life out of New York.
zh: 到时人们将会被马粪淹没。 所以1860年，他们认为，这种肮脏的科技 将扼杀纽约的生命。

en: So what happens? In 40 years' time, in the year 1900,  in the United States of America, there were 1,001  car manufacturing companies -- 1,001.
zh: 那么结果呢？40年之后，1900年， 美利坚合众国有了1,001家 汽车制造商--有1,001家之多。

en: The idea of finding a different technology  had absolutely taken over,  and there were tiny, tiny little factories in backwaters.
zh: 找到一种新科技取而代之 才是发展的王道， 而停滞不前的小工厂还有很多。

en: However, there is a secret to work with entrepreneurs.
zh: 然而，与创业者打交道有个秘诀。

en: Then you have to offer them absolute, dedicated,  passionate service to them.
zh: 然后你要为他们提供专注 而热情的服务。

en: The smallest company, the biggest company,  has to be capable of doing three things beautifully:  The product that you want to sell has to be fantastic,  you have to have fantastic marketing,  and you have to have tremendous financial management.
zh: 不论是大公司还是小企业， 都能把以下三件事做得很好： 产品质量要过硬， 市场营销要高效， 财务管理要精明。

en: We have never met a single human being  in the world who can make it, sell it and look after the money.
zh: 这世上从来没有一个人 能同时做好生产、销售以及财务的工作。

en: It doesn't exist.
zh: 这种人不存在。

en: This person has never been born.
zh: 这样的能人尚未出生。

en: We've done the research, and we have looked  at the 100 iconic companies of the world --  Carnegie, Westinghouse, Edison, Ford,  all the new companies, Google, Yahoo.
zh: 我们做过调查，对世界上 100家标杆企业进行研究-- 卡内基培训公司，西屋公司，爱迪生公司，福特汽车公司， 以及所有这些新兴产业的公司，如谷歌，雅虎。

en: There's only one thing that all the successful companies  in the world have in common, only one:  None were started by one person.
zh: 世界上所有成功的企业只有一个 共同点，只有一个： 没有一个企业是靠一人之力创建的。

en: Now we teach entrepreneurship to 16-year-olds  in Northumberland, and we start the class  by giving them the first two pages of Richard Branson's autobiography,  and the task of the 16-year-olds is to underline,  in the first two pages of Richard Branson's autobiography  how many times Richard uses the word "I"  and how many times he uses the word "we."
zh: 现在我们在诺森伯兰郡 教授16岁青年们创业学，我们一开始 把理查德·布兰森自传的前两页给他们看， 这些学生们的任务就是用下划线标出 并统计理查德·布兰森自传前两页中 用了多少次“我”这个字 和用了多少次“我们”这个词。

en: He wasn't alone when he started.
zh: 他刚起步时并非单枪匹马。

en: Nobody started a company alone. No one.
zh: 没人能独自创立一个企业。没人。

en: So we can create the community  where we have facilitators who come from a small business background  sitting in cafes, in bars, and your dedicated buddies  who will do to you, what somebody did for this gentleman  who talks about this epic,  somebody who will say to you, "What do you need?
zh: 所以我们可以建立一个社区， 在这个社区里，我们有来自小型企业背景的辅助商 在咖啡馆中、酒吧里为你出谋划策， 我们能为你提供这位满怀抱负的先生 所受到的帮助， 我们会问你：“你需要什么？

en: What can you do? Can you make it?
zh: 你能做什么？你能生产出来吗？

en: Okay, can you sell it? Can you look after the money?"
zh: 你能销售出去吗？你能打理资金吗？”

en: "Oh, no, I cannot do this.""Would you like me to find you somebody?"
zh: “啊，这个我办不到。”“那要我替你找人帮忙吗？”

en: We have groups of volunteers supporting the Enterprise Facilitator  to help you to find resources and people  and we have discovered that the miracle  of the intelligence of local people is such  that you can change the culture and the economy  of this community just by capturing the passion,  the energy and imagination of your own people.
zh: 我们有志愿者团队帮助创业辅助商 为客户集结资源及人力。 我们发现当地人群的智慧 能创造出奇迹 能改变社区的文化和经济， 只要你能好好利用人们这份热情， 这种活力，这种想象力。

en: Thank you.
zh: 谢谢。

en: There are a lot of ways the people around us  can help improve our lives.
zh: 我们周围的人能以很多种方式 来帮我们把生活变得更美好

en: We don't bump into every neighbor,  so a lot of wisdom never gets passed on,  though we do share the same public spaces.
zh: 我们不一定能常常碰到我们的邻居 所以即使我们生活在同一片公共空间里 邻居的智慧也难以被传递开来

en: How can we lend and borrow more things,  without knocking on each other's doors at a bad time?
zh: 我们怎么样能够从邻里间互借到更多的东西 同时避免在不合时宜的时候敲开对方的门？

en: How can we share more of our hopes for our vacant storefronts,  so our communities can reflect our needs and dreams today?
zh: 怎样更能表达我们对空置的店面的期待 使我们的社区能反映出 我们现在的需求和梦想？

en: Now, I live in New Orleans,  and I am in love with New Orleans.
zh: 我现时住在新奥尔良 并深深地爱上了这座城市

en: My soul is always soothed by the giant live oak trees,  shading lovers, drunks and dreamers for hundreds of years,  and I trust a city that always makes way for music.
zh: 那些生生不息的巨型橡树总是可以抚慰我的灵魂 几百年来，情侣、醉汉和追梦人们 总会稍息在树影下 我深信这一座充满着音乐律动的城市

en: I feel like every time someone sneezes,  New Orleans has a parade.   The city has some of the most beautiful architecture in the world,  but it also has one of the highest amounts of abandoned properties in America.
zh: 每当有人打喷嚏时， 我都感觉新奥尔良来了一只游行队伍 新奥尔良拥有世界上很多最漂亮的建筑 但同时，她也是全美拥有最多 废弃建筑的城市

en: I live near this house,  and I thought about how I could make it a nicer space for my neighborhood,  and I also thought about something that changed my life forever.
zh: 我住在这栋房子附近，我就想如何让它 在这片社区里成为一个更好的地方 也思考了另一件事 这件事彻底改变了我的人生

en: In 2009, I lost someone I loved very much.
zh: 2009年，我失去了一个我挚爱的人

en: Her name was Joan, and she was a mother to me.
zh: 她的名字叫琼，对我来讲，她就像我的母亲一样

en: And ... this made me feel deep gratitude for the time I've had.
zh: 然后⋯⋯ 这件事让我对我拥有的时光怀着深切致意

en: And ... brought clarity to the things that are meaningful to my life now.
zh: 并且 显现出了那些 对我的生命有真正意义的东西

en: But I struggle to maintain this perspective in my daily life.
zh: 但我却很难在日常生活中保持这种心态

en: I feel like it's easy to get caught up in the day-to-day,  and forget what really matters to you.
zh: 我觉得人们太容易被日复一日的琐碎困住 而忘记什么才是真正重要的事

en: So with help from old and new friends,  I turned the side of this abandoned house into a giant chalkboard,  and stenciled it with a fill-in-the-blank sentence:  "Before I die, I want to ..."
zh: 我于是在一些新老朋友的帮助下 把这栋废弃的房子的一面墙 做成了一个巨型黑板 我在上面写满了同一道填空题 “在死之前，我想⋯⋯”

en: So anyone walking by can pick up a piece of chalk,  reflect on their life,  and share their personal aspirations in public space.
zh: 所以每一个路过的人都可以捡起一根粉笔 在公共场合里留下一些他们人生的痕迹 且来分享他们内心深处的愿望

en: I didn't know what to expect from this experiment,  but by the next day, the wall was entirely filled out,  and it kept growing.
zh: 我并不知道该从这个实验里期待些什么 但是第二天，整个墙壁都被填满了 而且不断有人添加新的答案

en: "Before I die, I want to be tried for piracy."   "Before I die, I want to straddle the International Dateline."
zh: “在死之前，我想为我的海盗行为接受审判” “在死之前，我想跨过国际日期变更线”

en: "Before I die, I want to sing for millions."
zh: “在死之前，我想在上百万的观众面前唱歌”

en: "Before I die, I want to plant a tree."
zh: “在死之前，我想种一棵树”

en: "Before I die, I want to live off the grid."
zh: “在死之前，我想过隐居的生活”

en: "Before I die, I want to hold her one more time."
zh: “在死之前，我想再抱她一次”

en: "Before I die, I want to be someone's cavalry."
zh: “在死之前，我想成为某个人的骑士”

en: "Before I die, I want to be completely myself."
zh: “在死之前，我想要做完全真实的自己”

en: I made this last year,  and started receiving hundreds of messages from passionate people  who wanted to make a wall with their community.
zh: 这个黑板是我去年做的，然后我就不断收到 一些热情的人们给我发的信息 说想在他们的社区里也设立一面这样的墙壁

en: In our age of increasing distractions,  it's more important than ever to find ways to maintain perspective,  and remember that life is brief and tender.
zh: 在这个物欲横流的时代里 努力坚持自我，铭记人生的短暂与生命的脆弱 变得比以往任何时代都更重要

en: Death is something that we're often discouraged to talk about,  or even think about,  but I've realized that preparing for death  is one of the most empowering things you can do.
zh: 我们总是没有勇气谈论死亡 甚至没有勇气去想着死亡 但是我意识到，为死亡做心理准备 是我们能够做到的最有力的事情之一

en: Thinking about death clarifies your life.
zh: 思考死亡能够让你对自己的人生有更清醒的认识

en: Our shared spaces can better reflect what matters to us,  as individuals and as a community,  and with more ways to share our hopes, fears and stories,  the people around us can not only help us make better places,  they can help us lead better lives.
zh: 公共空间可以更好的体现到底什么对我们是真正重要的 无论是对个人来说或者对于整个社区来说 有了更多的方式来分享我们的希望，恐惧和经历 我们身边的人不仅能够帮助我们创造更美好的地方 更帮助我们过上更美好的生活

en: Thank you.
zh: 谢谢

en: Thank you.
zh: 谢谢

en: Please don't tell me I'm normal.
zh: 不要说我是正常人

en: He's speechless, but he communicates joy  in a way that some of the best orators cannot.
zh: 他不讲话，但能传达欢乐 用他特有的方式，最好的演讲家也望尘莫及

en: He shares it unconditionally and he shares it regardless.
zh: 他无条件无保留地分享他的那份爱

en: He's not greedy. He doesn't see skin color.
zh: 他不贪心，也不在乎别人是什么肤色

en: He doesn't care about religious differences, and get this:  He has never told a lie.
zh: 他无所谓宗教信仰的差异，还有： 他从来没说过谎

en: When he sings songs from our childhood,  attempting words that not even I could remember,  he reminds me of one thing:  how little we know about the mind, and how wonderful  the unknown must be.
zh: 当他唱起我们儿时的歌谣 唱出就连我都忘记了的歌词 他提醒了我 我们对精神知之甚少 而未知的事物是如此迷人

en: Samuel is 16. He's tall. He's very handsome.
zh: Samuel今年16岁，也是又高又帅

en: He has a selective one, though.
zh: 但这记忆力是有选择性的

en: He doesn't remember if he stole my chocolate bar,  but he remembers the year of release for every song on my iPod,  conversations we had when he was four,  weeing on my arm on the first ever episode of Teletubbies,  and Lady Gaga's birthday.
zh: 他不记得偷了我的巧克力棒 但记得我iPod里面每首歌的发行年份 他四岁时我们的谈话 看天线宝宝第一集时尿在我手臂上的囧事 还有Lady Gaga的生日

en: Don't they sound incredible?
zh: 听起来很神奇吧？

en: But what lifted my heart and strengthened my soul  was that even though this was the case,  although they were not seen as ordinary,  this could only mean one thing:  that they were extraordinary --  autistic and extraordinary.
zh: 但让我坚定信念的是 即使现实如此 就算他们不被当作正常人看 这也只说明了一件事 他们是非凡的 虽然患有自闭症，但非凡无比

en: Now, for you who may be less familiar with the term "autism,"  it's a complex brain disorder that affects social communication,  learning and sometimes physical skills.
zh: 你们中的一些人可能还不太了解“孤独症”这个术语 它是由复杂的大脑功能紊乱而导致的社交障碍 学习障碍，有时伴有运动功能障碍

en: It manifests in each individual differently,  hence why Remi is so different from Sam.
zh: 每一个病例的情况都是特殊的 所以Remi与Sam的情况也是不同的

en: And I cannot remember the first moment I encountered autism,  but I cannot recall a day without it.
zh: 我记不起第一次知道“孤独症”这个词的情形 我也记不起有哪一天我是对“孤独症”一无所知的

en: I was just three years old when my brother came along,  and I was so excited that  I had a new being in my life.
zh: 我三岁的时候，弟弟出生了 我非常兴奋 我有了新的家人

en: Remi lived and reigned in his own world, with his own rules,  and he found pleasure in the smallest things,  like lining up cars around the room  and staring at the washing machine  and eating anything that came in between.
zh: Remi沉浸在他自己的世界里，应用他自己制定的法则 他从细微的事物中寻找乐趣 比如绕着屋子排列他的玩具车 盯着洗衣机 把他和洗衣机之间的所有东西都吃下去
